Q/A.question: What is KVM and what type of hardware does it require?
Q/A.answer: KVM (Kernel-based Virtual Machine) is a full virtualization solution for Linux on x86 hardware containing virtualization extensions (Intel VT or AMD-V).

Q/A.question: What are the names of the kernel modules associated with KVM?
Q/A.answer: The kernel consists of a loadable kernel module, kvm.ko, and a processor specific module, which can be either kvm-intel.ko or kvm-amd.ko.

Q/A.question: As of which Linux version is the KVM kernel component included in mainline Linux?
Q/A.answer: The kernel component of KVM is included in mainline Linux as of version 2.6.20.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended storage for the system image of a virtual machine using KVM?
Q/A.answer: The system image for the virtual machine should be on local disk space.

Q/A.question: What can happen if a running virtual machine is placed on networked file space?
Q/A.answer: Putting a running virtual machine on networked file space will result in poor performance for both the virtual machine and other users of the filespace.

Q/A.question: What steps should UMIACS Staff follow to start using KVM on a machine?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS Staff will first need to install the requisite packages and set a baseline configuration, followed by contacting staff with a brief explanation of the goals for running a local virtual machine.

Q/A.question: What user group must Ubuntu users belong to in order to use KVM?
Q/A.answer: Ubuntu requires users to be in the kvm group on the local host.

Q/A.question: Which program is used to initialize and manage virtual machines after the required packages are installed?
Q/A.answer: 'virt-manager' is the program used to initialize and manage virtual machines.

Q/A.question: What networking mode does KVM provide by default?
Q/A.answer: The default networking mode provided by KVM is usermode networking, which offers a NAT connection to the outside world.

Q/A.question: What command is used in the terminal to bring up the graphical interface for managing virtual machines?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'virt-manager -c qemu:///session'.

Q/A.question: Describe the process to forward ports during virtual machine configuration in KVM.
Q/A.answer: The functionality to forward ports is achieved by editing the XML file for your domain directly. First, create your VM with virt-manager and shut it down, then run 'virsh -c qemu:///session' in a shell to access the virsh shell and edit the VM's XML.

Q/A.question: According to the text, how would you forward port 2222 to port 22?
Q/A.answer: You need to replace the <domain> tag in the XML file with <domain type='kvm' xmlns:qemu='http://libvirt.org/schemas/domain/qemu/1.0'> and insert the lines '<qemu:commandline><qemu:arg value='-redir'/><qemu:arg value='tcp:2222::22'/></qemu:commandline>' just above the last </domain> tag.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to start a Windows installation in a more automated way?
Q/A.answer: The command 'virt-install' can be used to start a Windows installation in an automated fashion.

Q/A.question: What happens when virt-install is executed with a Windows 10 x64 ISO?
Q/A.answer: Executing virt-install with a Windows 10 x64 ISO spawns virt-viewer automatically and shows the Windows installer screen.

Q/A.question: What resources are specified in the virt-install command for creating a Windows virtual machine?
Q/A.answer: The resources specified include a 40G disk and 16GB of RAM.

Q/A.question: What is a common method that phishing attacks use to disguise themselves?
Q/A.answer: Phishing attacks may be hard to distinguish from legitimate administrative messages, especially those in which the supposed UMIACS staff advise or require users to take administrative actions related to their account.

Q/A.question: What should users do to verify the legitimacy of administrative actions suggested by the UMIACS staff?
Q/A.answer: Users should check the UMIACS intranet site, which will always have a posted announcement of any administrative actions intended for all UMIACS users.

Q/A.question: What URL should always be SSL-secured and reported as a secure connection when visited?
Q/A.answer: Any URL in the *.umiacs.umd.edu domain should always be SSL-secured and reported as a secure connection.

Q/A.question: What tool does UMIACS provide to confirm the legitimacy of messages from staff?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS provides a tool called Verify Staff GPG Messages from the UMIACS intranet site, which allows users to paste the text of the message and confirm that the sender is legitimate.

Q/A.question: Which communications will not be signed with a staff member's GPG key?
Q/A.answer: Communications that are initiated by users through the Jira ticket system or in response to these tickets will not be signed.

Q/A.question: List two signs that may indicate a phishing attempt.
Q/A.answer: Bogus to and from addresses (not within the UMIACS or UMD domains) and messages that do not directly reference you by name (e.g., 'Hello user' or 'Hello researcher').

Q/A.question: What should users do before clicking on links or opening attachments in a suspicious message?
Q/A.answer: Users should hover over links to check where they really point to instead of clicking on them.

Q/A.question: What immediate action should you take if you believe you've fallen victim to a phishing attack?
Q/A.answer: You should contact the Help Desk immediately.

Q/A.question: What preventive measures may be taken by UMIACS if you report a potential account compromise?
Q/A.answer: This typically will involve a password change as well as possibly locking out access to your account for some period of time while ensuring your account is secure.

Q/A.question: What is the general activity referred to as 'crawling' in the context of this text?
Q/A.answer: Web crawling, scraping, or otherwise downloading large sets of publicly available information on the Internet.

Q/A.question: What should one understand before crawling publicly accessible data?
Q/A.answer: One should understand if any publicly accessible data is encumbered or not, and what the restrictions are on any data that is crawled.

Q/A.question: What types of organizations might have restrictions on crawling despite providing access to academic institutions?

Q/A.question: What is advised against when dealing with limitations or restrictions of publicly available services?

Q/A.question: What resource limitations exist for jobs submitted in the cbcb and cbcb-heng partitions regarding core and RAM usage?

Q/A.question: What is the path format for accessing a user's public FTP space?
Q/A.answer: The public FTP space can be accessed at the path: asftp://ftp.umiacs.umd.edu/pub/<username>/.

Q/A.question: From which locations can users upload data to their public FTP site?

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of compressing files before archiving them?
Q/A.answer: The purpose of compressing files before archiving them is to allow the computer to store the same information and data on less disk space, as well as reduce transmission time of the file.

Q/A.question: Which command is used in Linux to create a compressed archive file?
Q/A.answer: The command used in Linux to create a compressed archive file is: tar czvf <FILENAME>.tar.gz <DIRECTORY>.

Q/A.question: In the context of creating a compressed archive in Linux, what does the '-c' command indicate?
Q/A.answer: The '-c' command indicates the creation of a file.

Q/A.question: How can one list the contents of a gzip tar file in Linux without extracting the data?
Q/A.answer: To list the contents of a gzip tar file without extracting the data in Linux, enter: tar tzvf <FILENAME>.tar.gz.

Q/A.question: What command is used to expand the contents of a gzip tar file in Linux?
Q/A.answer: The command used to expand the contents of a gzip tar file in Linux is: tar xzvf <FILENAME>.tar.gz.

Q/A.question: What is the command to create a compressed archive file from a folder in Windows?
Q/A.answer: To create a compressed archive file from a folder in Windows, the command is: Compress-Archive -Path <FOLDER PATH> -DestinationPath <PATH OF COMPRESSED / ARCHIVED FILE>.

Q/A.question: What should not be included at the end of the file name when creating a compressed archive file from a folder in Windows?
Q/A.answer: When creating a compressed archive file from a folder in Windows, do not write .zip at the end of the file.

Q/A.question: Which command is used in Windows to expand the contents of a compressed archive file?
Q/A.answer: The command used in Windows to expand the contents of a compressed archive file is: Expand-Archive -Path <FILE PATH>.zip -DestinationPath <FILE PATH OF UNZIPPED FILE>.

Q/A.question: What is Adobe primarily known for?

Q/A.question: What is the commonly deployed Adobe product at UMIACS?

Q/A.question: What option should faculty and staff choose when installing Creative Cloud products?

Q/A.question: What handles the licensing for Creative Cloud products installed on personal machines?
Q/A.answer: Licensing is handled through the user's UMD account.

Q/A.question: What are Security Groups used for in UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Security Groups are authentication groups that control access to various applications in UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What kind of access control do Security Groups provide?
Q/A.answer: They provide fine-grained access control to wikis, source code repositories, and certain web applications.

Q/A.question: How can a user view and edit the secgroups they belong to?
Q/A.answer: A user can view and edit the secgroups they belong to using the SecGroups section of the directory app.

Q/A.question: What is the URL for the SecGroups section of the directory app?

Q/A.question: What protocols are used by UMIACS labs to distribute shared data to workgroups?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS labs distribute shared data to workgroups using a wide variety of protocols including FTP, SFTP, SCP, NFS, and SMB.

Q/A.question: How can on-site clients access project directories?
Q/A.answer: On-site clients can access project directories through the Network File System (NFS) and Server Message Block (SMB) protocols.

Q/A.answer: Supported UNIX workstations map project directories to /fs/.

Q/A.answer: Windows workstations map project directories as \*.umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.answer: For directories on the Isilon, the path would be \isilondata.umiacs.umd.edu\.

Q/A.question: Is project data storage shared by default with every host?

Q/A.question: What action should one take to configure a new share for project data?

Q/A.question: What are the guidelines regarding the storage of personal data in project storage allocations?
Q/A.answer: The guidelines advise avoiding storing personal data in project storage allocations.

Q/A.question: Why is it recommended to separate project data from personal data?
Q/A.answer: Separating project data from personal data will simplify administration and data management for both researchers and staff.

Q/A.question: What command should be used on Windows to check the IP address configuration?
Q/A.answer: type ipconfig /all into the command prompt.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the PING utility?
Q/A.answer: PING is a network utility that sends ICMP packets to a specified host to test network connectivity.

Q/A.question: How can you specify the number of times to ping a destination host on Linux/UNIX?
Q/A.answer: You may want to add the -c flag followed by a number to specify how many times to ping the destination host.

Q/A.question: What command is used on Windows to perform a traceroute?
Q/A.answer: In a command prompt type 'tracert' followed by the hostname or IP address of the host.

Q/A.question: What might be a reason for networking issues if your IP address is manually set?
Q/A.answer: If your machine happens to have a manually set IP address that conflicts with that of another host, networking issues may arise.

Q/A.question: What option could help if you are behind a firewall and having trouble accessing a service?
Q/A.answer: You can connect to the VPN, or use SSH tunneling.

Q/A.question: What does 'dns.address' in a URL represent?

Q/A.question: Is the ':port' section of a URL optional, and what type of value is it?
Q/A.answer: Yes, ':port' is optional and is always a numeric value.

Q/A.question: What is the primary function of the Ubuntu Software Center?
Q/A.answer: The Ubuntu Software Center provides a mechanism to install many different applications and libraries to your Ubuntu desktop without requiring 'su' or 'sudo' (administrative) access.

Q/A.question: What should a primary user of a UMIACS-supported Ubuntu machine do if they do not have adequate permissions to install software?
Q/A.answer: They should contact staff and provide both their hostname and username.

Q/A.question: How can a user launch the Ubuntu Software Center using the Dashboard?
Q/A.answer: By typing the meta key (commonly referred to as the Windows key) to open the dashboard and then typing 'Software Center' in the search box.

Q/A.question: What command can be used in the terminal to launch the Ubuntu Software Center?
Q/A.answer: 'software-center' should be typed in the terminal to launch the Ubuntu Software Center.

Q/A.question: What is a limitation of using the Ubuntu Software Center via X11 Forwarding?
Q/A.answer: The Ubuntu Software Center cannot be used via X11 Forwarding due to limitations, and updates must be done on the physical machine.

Q/A.question: What is the preferred method of providing locally-built software to the Institute?
Q/A.answer: Modules is now the preferred method of providing locally-built software to the Institute.

Q/A.question: What command is used to manage the /opt/local directory?
Q/A.answer: The Stow system is used to manage the /opt/local directory.

Q/A.question: Where can you list a specific piece of software under /opt/local?
Q/A.answer: You can list the directory /opt/local/stow for a specific piece of software.

Q/A.question: Which directories are linked with the stow command for software?
Q/A.answer: The stow command links software directly into the bin, lib, man, and sbin directories in /opt/local.

Q/A.question: For which versions of the operating system does this information pertain?
Q/A.answer: This information pertains to RHEL7 and above.

Q/A.question: Where was software previously found before it was managed in /opt/local?
Q/A.answer: Software was previously found in /usr/local.

Q/A.question: What are the prerequisites for accessing the UMIACS VPN?
Q/A.answer: A full UMIACS account, a device enrolled with UMIACS Duo for multi-factor authentication, and an established network connection (wired or wireless).

Q/A.question: Which Pulse Secure Client versions are available for different Linux distributions?
Q/A.answer: 64 bit Pulse Secure Client .deb for Debian-based Linux (e.g. Ubuntu) and 64 bit Pulse Secure Client .rpm for Fedora-based Linux (e.g. Red Hat).

Q/A.question: What should a user do upon starting the Pulse Secure Client for the first time?
Q/A.answer: It may ask to upgrade the client, which will pull an up-to-date version of the client with the most recent configuration.

Q/A.question: What command is used to install the Pulse Secure Client on a Debian-based OS?
Q/A.answer: sudo dpkg -i <insert_filename_here>.deb

Q/A.question: What additional packages must be installed before proceeding with the installation on a Debian-based OS?
Q/A.answer: libnss3-tools and net-tools.

Q/A.question: What is the server URL that needs to be entered when creating a new VPN connection?
Q/A.answer: vpn.umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What options are provided for the secondary password when connecting to the VPN?
Q/A.answer: push, phone, or <press YubiKey>.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they want to register a YubiKey for use with the VPN?
Q/A.answer: Contact UMIACS Tech Staff.

Q/A.question: What should a user select on the secondary authentication prompt to use their preferred method automatically?
Q/A.answer: 'Save Settings'.

Q/A.question: How can a user check the VPN connection status?
Q/A.answer: Launch the Pulse Client GUI and select the down arrow to show connection status.

Q/A.question: What types of hard drives can BitLocker be used on?
Q/A.answer: BitLocker can be used on fixed hard drives (i.e. internal to your computer) as well as on portable hard drives (i.e. USB).

Q/A.question: What is the preferred file system format for a portable hard drive needed for BitLocker?
Q/A.answer: The preferred file system format for a portable hard drive needed for BitLocker is NTFS.

Q/A.question: What must be installed on the machine before initializing the YubiKey for encryption?
Q/A.answer: The YubiKey personalization tool must be downloaded and installed on the machine before initializing the YubiKey for encryption.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the recovery key in BitLocker?
Q/A.answer: The recovery key is the only way to get into the encrypted drive if you lose the YubiKey.

Q/A.question: What should be done with the recovery key text file after adding it to the database in KeePassXC?
Q/A.answer: The recovery key text file should be deleted permanently after adding it to the database in KeePassXC.

Q/A.question: What does the auto-unlock feature do in BitLocker?
Q/A.answer: The auto-unlock feature allows an encrypted drive to auto-unlock for specific user(s) when plugged into specific computer(s).

Q/A.question: What is a strongly recommended practice regarding the management of USB flash drives containing the recovery key?
Q/A.answer: It is strongly recommended to copy the contents of the first USB flash drive onto one or more additional USB flash drives to safeguard against loss of both the YubiKey and any single USB flash drive.

Q/A.question: How does a user unlock the drive using the YubiKey?
Q/A.answer: To unlock the drive using the YubiKey, the user should physically plug the drive and YubiKey in, then touch the YubiKey's sensor for 3 seconds to emit the password, which will automatically unlock the drive.

Q/A.question: What does BitLocker recommend doing before disconnecting the portable hard drive from the machine?
Q/A.answer: BitLocker recommends waiting for encryption to complete before disconnecting the portable hard drive from the machine.

Q/A.question: What happens if a user loses their YubiKey according to the instructions provided?
Q/A.answer: If a user loses their YubiKey, it is strongly recommended to buy a new YubiKey, decrypt BitLocker on the drive, and then repeat the initial procedure to re-encrypt it with the new YubiKey.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of input method editors (IMEs)?
Q/A.answer: IMEs make it easier to type in languages that are made up of thousands of characters that can't fit on a standard keyboard.

Q/A.question: What is indicated about the nature of IMEs in relation to user privileges?
Q/A.answer: IMEs are a per user setting and can be added/removed/customized without any need for administrative privileges.

Q/A.question: What is the first step in adding an IME to your account according to the instructions?
Q/A.answer: Click the Windows button and open the control panel.

Q/A.question: After opening the control panel, which option should be selected to change input methods?
Q/A.answer: Click 'Clock, Language, and Region'.

Q/A.question: What action should you take after clicking 'Change keyboards or other input methods'?
Q/A.answer: Click the 'Change Keyboards' button.

Q/A.question: How do you identify which IMEs are currently installed on your system?
Q/A.answer: A dialogue box will open with a list of your currently installed input methods (aka keyboards).

Q/A.question: What should you do after clicking the 'Add' button in the input methods dialogue box?
Q/A.answer: Another dialogue box will open with a list of languages; scroll through these until you find the language you want to add.

Q/A.question: What additional step is required to enable an IME for a specific language?
Q/A.answer: Check any of the IMEs that you want to enable and then click the 'Ok' button.

Q/A.question: What is the significance of clicking 'Apply' after making changes to the IMEs?
Q/A.answer: Click 'Apply' to close the dialogue box and apply your changes.

Q/A.question: What new feature appears if this is the first time an IME has been added?
Q/A.answer: A new icon should appear in the bottom right corner of your screen near the taskbar that allows you to switch between IMEs and configure them.

Q/A.question: How can users access help pages or configure their IMEs?
Q/A.answer: Click the Options Menu icon on the right side of the language bar.

Q/A.question: What is the error message received at the beginning of the text?
Q/A.answer: Warning: no access to tty (Bad file descriptor).

Q/A.question: What rank is responsible for sending the message '0' to rank 1?
Q/A.answer: Rank 0.

Q/A.question: How many total ranks are involved in sending and receiving messages as per the text?
Q/A.answer: Eight ranks (from rank 0 to rank 7).

Q/A.question: Which rank finishes its operations last according to the provided information?
Q/A.answer: Rank 7.

Q/A.question: During the messaging process, what does Rank 2 do when it receives message '4' from rank 4?
Q/A.answer: Rank 2 sends message '2' to rank 4.

Q/A.question: What does Rank 5 do upon receiving message '2' from rank 2?
Q/A.answer: Rank 5 sends message '5' to rank 2.

Q/A.question: Which ranks do not send messages to themselves according to the messaging operations described?
Q/A.answer: Ranks 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7 all do not send messages to themselves.

Q/A.question: In the context of the message-passing operation, what does Rank 3 do when it receives message '6' from rank 6?
Q/A.answer: Rank 3 sends message '3' to rank 6.

Q/A.question: What command is used to check the availability of software in the module system?
Q/A.answer: module avail

Q/A.question: What happens when a user runs the module add command without specifying a version for a piece of software that has no default version?
Q/A.answer: They will load the most recent version of it.

Q/A.question: Which command would you use to list the currently loaded modules in your environment?
Q/A.answer: module list

Q/A.question: What does the show command do in relation to a specific module?
Q/A.answer: It shows what the module is going to add to your environment and the dependencies that will be added.

Q/A.question: Which command can be used to remove a module from your environment?
Q/A.answer: module rm <module>

Q/A.question: In non-interactive shell sessions, why might the Modules configuration environment not load automatically?
Q/A.answer: Because the OS version of the compute node scheduled differs from the OS version of the submission node.

Q/A.question: What are users advised to do to get the module command to work in RHEL9 desktop sessions?
Q/A.answer: Source the modules init script.

Q/A.question: Which shell family does the Modules system automatically customize the environment for?
Q/A.answer: bash/sh (default shell) and tcsh/csh.

Q/A.question: If a piece of software has a default version, how is it indicated in the output of module avail?
Q/A.answer: By (default) coming after their name/version.

Q/A.question: What paths are prepended to the environment variables when loading the cuda/12.1.1 module?
Q/A.answer: PATH, LD_LIBRARY_PATH, LD_RUN_PATH, LIBRARY_PATH, CPATH, PKG_CONFIG_PATH.

Q/A.question: What is recommended for storing data that is actively being worked on in the context of a cluster job?
Q/A.answer: It is recommended to store data that is actively being worked on as close to the processing source as possible, specifically on a disk physically installed in the compute node itself.

Q/A.question: What is the first step in the suggested workflow for a computational job?
Q/A.answer: The first step is to copy the data to be processed to local disk space of the compute node(s) your job is assigned.

Q/A.question: Why is it important to utilize local disks on compute nodes during cluster jobs?
Q/A.answer: Utilizing the local disks on the compute nodes helps distribute the data access load and reduce the load on the file server, improving performance.

Q/A.question: List two benefits of storing data in an archive file when not actively being processed.
Q/A.answer: Two benefits are faster data transfers and reduced data size.

Q/A.question: What common utilities can be used to create archive files?
Q/A.answer: Common utilities for creating archive files are tar and zip.

Q/A.question: What naming convention does local disk space at UMIACS typically follow?
Q/A.answer: Local disk space typically conforms to the guideline where the directory name starts with /scratch.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they have questions about the available local disk space on a given cluster?
Q/A.answer: The user should refer to the documentation specific for that cluster or contact the UMIACS Help Desk.

Q/A.question: Why are local disk spaces considered transitory in UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Local disk space is considered transitory and is not backed up, making it not intended for long-term storage of critical/sensitive data.

Q/A.question: What does NAS stand for in the context of this document?
Q/A.answer: Network Attached Storage

Q/A.question: What are the two categories of Network Attached Storage mentioned?
Q/A.answer: Network Attached Storage for Users and Network Attached Storage for Projects

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the NAS as described in the text?
Q/A.answer: To provide storage solutions for users and projects.

Q/A.question: What type of account is a Collaborator account?
Q/A.answer: A Collaborator account is a sponsored provisional account for non-UMIACS members.

Q/A.question: What access do Collaborator accounts provide?
Q/A.answer: Collaborator accounts provide access to UMIACS applications such as GitLab, Object Storage, and MediaWiki instances.

Q/A.question: Do Collaborator accounts provide login access to UMIACS computers?
Q/A.answer: No, Collaborator accounts do not provide login access to UMIACS computers.

Q/A.question: How is access to a group's resources managed for Collaborator accounts?
Q/A.answer: Access to a group's resources is mediated through Security Groups, which can be managed in the UMIACS Directory Application.

Q/A.question: What is required for a Collaborator account to be created?
Q/A.answer: A UMIACS Account holder has to sponsor the Collaborator Account.

Q/A.question: Where do you go to sponsor a Collaborator account?
Q/A.answer: Sponsorship is done in the UMIACS Requests Application.

Q/A.question: What happens once a Collaborator has created their account?
Q/A.answer: An email will be sent to both the account sponsor and the Collaborator that the account is ready to use.

Q/A.question: What management actions are available for a sponsor regarding their Collaborators?
Q/A.answer: The following management actions are available: Send Password Reset and Remove Sponsorship.

Q/A.question: What does the 'Take Over Sponsorship' action do?
Q/A.answer: It notifies staff to transfer sponsorship to the requester, and the original sponsor of the Collaborator will be notified.

Q/A.question: What is the primary client used to access the UMIACS VPN?
Q/A.answer: Ivanti Connect Secure Client.

Q/A.question: What alternative method can be used to establish a UMIACS VPN connection if the primary client is unavailable?
Q/A.answer: A web browser at the URL https://vpn.umiacs.umd.edu/

Q/A.question: What specific requirement is mentioned for computers with ARM-based processors?
Q/A.answer: They require a different installer than the standard Windows one.

Q/A.question: List the prerequisites needed to connect to the UMIACS VPN.
Q/A.answer: A full UMIACS account, device enrolled with UMIACS Duo for multi-factor authentication, and an established network connection (wired or wireless).

Q/A.question: What should users do if prompted to upgrade the Ivanti Secure client upon starting it for the first time?
Q/A.answer: They should allow it to pull an up-to-date version of the client with the most recent configuration.

Q/A.question: What must be entered in the server URL field when creating a new VPN connection?
Q/A.answer: vpn.umiacs.umd.edu

Q/A.question: How does the multi-factor authentication system for the Pulse VPN work?
Q/A.answer: It prompts for credentials twice, requiring a secondary password for MFA, which could be a push notification, a call verification, or a one-time password from a YubiKey.

Q/A.question: What should users do to register a YubiKey for use with the VPN?
Q/A.answer: They should contact UMIACS Tech Staff.

Q/A.question: What icon indicates a successful connection to the UMIACS VPN in the status bar?
Q/A.answer: An S icon with a green arrow.

Q/A.question: What happens if there is no icon or a different icon in the status bar?
Q/A.answer: It means the user is not connected.

Q/A.question: What is stated about the support for 32-bit clients?
Q/A.answer: 32-bit clients are no longer supported by Ivanti.

Q/A.question: What should users select on the secondary authentication prompt to save time for future logins?
Q/A.answer: Select ‘Save Settings’.

Q/A.question: Which version of the Pulse Secure client needs to be downloaded for ARM processors?
Q/A.answer: Windows 64 bit ARM Pulse Secure Client.

Q/A.question: Where can the NAGWare Fortran compiler be found on supported RHEL7/Ubuntu hosts?

Q/A.question: What is the suggested method for loading the NAGWare compiler binaries into the environment?
Q/A.answer: Using GNU Modules

Q/A.question: What file must be created to perform the Hello World example using the NAGWare Fortran compiler?
Q/A.answer: hello.f95

Q/A.answer: module load nagware

Q/A.question: What output is expected when the Hello World program is run after compilation?
Q/A.answer: Hello World!

Q/A.question: What command compiles the Hello World program using the NAGWare Fortran compiler?
Q/A.answer: f95 -o hello hello.f95

Q/A.question: List the versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux supported by UMIACS.
Q/A.answer: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Q/A.question: Which Windows operating systems are supported by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Windows 10 / Windows Server 2022, Windows 11

Q/A.question: Identify the macOS versions that UMIACS supports.
Q/A.answer: macOS 13.x, macOS 14.x, macOS 15.x

Q/A.question: How many versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux does UMIACS support?
Q/A.answer: Three versions: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8, and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Q/A.question: What is the highest version of macOS supported by UMIACS as per the document?
Q/A.answer: macOS 15.x

Q/A.question: What are the two main components of a full UMIACS account?
Q/A.answer: Active Directory Account and Jira Account.

Q/A.question: What is required to fill out the UMIACS account request form?
Q/A.answer: You need to enter your PI/Professor/Sponsor's account name and indicate any labs you are a member of in the notes field.

Q/A.question: What is the minimum password length required for Active Directory passwords at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The minimum password length is 8 characters.

Q/A.question: How does one change their Jira password?
Q/A.answer: Changing your Jira password does not change your Active Directory Account password, and it can be set separately.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you forget your UMIACS password?
Q/A.answer: You must reset it using the UMIACS Password Web Application.

Q/A.question: What conditions must be met to reset your password if you do not know your current password?
Q/A.answer: You must know your username and have already registered a mobile phone number and alternate E-mail address in the Directory Application.

Q/A.question: What is the procedure if a UMIACS Collaborator Account password needs to be reset?
Q/A.answer: The password can be reset by your sponsor via the Requests Application.

Q/A.question: What is one of the password security policies regarding previously used passwords?
Q/A.answer: The password cannot be one that was previously used in your last 10 passwords.

Q/A.question: What can a sponsor do regarding the accounts they sponsor?
Q/A.answer: They can view a list of the accounts they sponsor and manage details such as installation date or email forward.

Q/A.question: What action is required to secure a password according to UMIACS policy?
Q/A.answer: It is your responsibility to secure your password, not to use your UMIACS password for any other service, and to connect using secure protocols.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of UMIACS Class Accounts?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS Class Accounts support classes for all of UMIACS/CSD via the Nexus cluster.

Q/A.question: What must students do if they do not receive an account notification email after their TA or instructor requests an account?
Q/A.answer: They must contact their TA or instructor.

Q/A.question: How long do students have to redeem their account before the redemption token expires?
Q/A.answer: Students must redeem the account within 7 days.

Q/A.question: What is required for logging onto the class submission host after account installation?
Q/A.answer: Students must register for MFA (multi-factor authentication) under UMIACS's Duo instance.

Q/A.question: What is the location of a student’s home directory in UMIACS Class Accounts?
Q/A.answer: /fs/classhomes/<semester><year>/<coursecode>/<username>

Q/A.question: What is the maximum quota for a student's home directory?
Q/A.answer: The maximum quota for a student's home directory is 30GB.

Q/A.question: How can a student request additional personal storage beyond the 30GB quota?
Q/A.answer: A student can request up to another 100GB of personal storage by having their TA or instructor contact staff.

Q/A.question: What is the method of job scheduling that UMIACS Class Accounts must use for computational jobs?
Q/A.answer: Students must schedule their jobs with the SLURM workload manager.

Q/A.question: What submission parameters can Class accounts access in SLURM?
Q/A.answer: --partition - class, --account - class, --qos - default, medium, and high.

Q/A.question: What is the correct command to view the available nodes in the class partition using SLURM?
Q/A.answer: The correct command is 'show_nodes -p class'.

Q/A.answer: Login shells (ssh, console)

Q/A.answer: It controls the order that programs are found in your path.

Q/A.question: What format is the list of current paths displayed in when using echo $PATH?

Q/A.question: What types of data storage devices does UMIACS Staff securely destroy?

Q/A.question: What should you do if you want a device securely destroyed at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Stop by the help desk to have the device placed in the pile for mass destruction dropoff.

Q/A.question: What are the University's Data Retention Guidelines related to?
Q/A.answer: They are related to the destruction of university-owned data storage devices.

Q/A.question: What method of destruction is always recommended when destroying a data storage device?
Q/A.answer: Physical destruction.

Q/A.question: Which organization's guidelines are recommended for data storage device destruction?
Q/A.answer: NIST (National Institute of Standards and Technology).

Q/A.question: What should one adhere to when physically destroying a university-owned data storage device?
Q/A.answer: Guidelines published by NIST.

Q/A.question: Where can the guidelines published by NIST for media sanitization be found?

What type of memory does the A100 PCIe 80GB use?

Q/A.answer: H100 NVLink

Q/A.question: What is the number of GB of memory for the RTX A5000?

Q/A.question: How many physical cards are connected over NVLink for the H100 NVLink GPU?

Q/A.question: How many Barracuda Networks spam firewalls has UMIACS deployed?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS has deployed a system with 2 Barracuda Networks spam firewalls.

Q/A.question: What email format should users use to log in to the Barracuda spam firewalls?
Q/A.answer: Users should log in using their UMIACS email address in the format username@umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What will users receive daily at approximately 3:30 PM EST from the Barracuda?
Q/A.answer: Users will receive a mail with their quarantine summary.

Q/A.question: What happens to the quarantine mail after 21 days?
Q/A.answer: Mail held in quarantine for longer than 21 days will be purged.

Q/A.question: What do Barracuda spam firewalls do with messages that pass through them?
Q/A.answer: The Barracudas will score every message that passes through them and inject varying message headers based on that score.

Q/A.question: Where can users find the guide to enable quarantine passthrough?
Q/A.answer: Users can find the guide to enable quarantine passthrough at BarracudaSpamFirewall/QuarantinePassthrough.

Q/A.question: What filtering options can be set up through the Preferences tab in the Barracuda web portal?
Q/A.answer: Users can set up whitelists, blacklists, and Bayesian filtering options through the Preferences tab.

Q/A.question: What action must users take if they receive a security warning in their browser after clicking the Barracuda link?
Q/A.answer: Users may need to add the UMIACS Certificate Authority.

Q/A.question: How can users search their spam quarantine?
Q/A.answer: Users can search their spam quarantine by following the steps at BarracudaSpamFirewall/SearchingQuarantine.

Q/A.question: What should users do to log in if the auto log-in through the daily summary link is not working?
Q/A.answer: Users should use the links provided above to log in.

Q/A.question: What is the full name of the CBCB lab?
Q/A.answer: Center for Bioinformatics and Computational Biology

Q/A.question: Which lab focuses on health-related informatics and bioimaging?
Q/A.answer: Center for Health-related Informatics and Bioimaging

Q/A.question: What does the abbreviation CfAR stand for?
Q/A.answer: Center for Automation Research

Q/A.question: Which laboratory is associated with machine learning?
Q/A.answer: Center for Machine Learning

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the Distributed Systems Software Laboratory (DSSL)?
Q/A.answer: The text does not specify the purpose, but it is inferred to be focused on distributed systems software.

Q/A.question: Name one laboratory that deals with human-computer interaction.
Q/A.answer: Human Computer Interaction Laboratory (HCIL)

Q/A.question: Which lab has a focus on computational linguistics?
Q/A.answer: Computational Linguistics and Information Processing (CLIP)

Q/A.question: What is the link to the Maryland Cybersecurity Center?
Q/A.answer: http://cyber.umd.edu/

Q/A.question: Which lab is affiliated with quantum information and computer science?
Q/A.answer: Joint Center for Quantum Information and Computer Science (QUICS)

Q/A.question: Which laboratory corresponds to the abbreviation MAXWell?
Q/A.answer: Lab for Broadband Mobile Communications

Q/A.question: What is the primary function of the Nexus in UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The Nexus is the combined scheduler of resources in UMIACS.

Q/A.question: Which resource manager is used for Nexus?
Q/A.answer: The resource manager for Nexus is SLURM.

Q/A.question: What determines access to submission nodes for Nexus computational resources?
Q/A.answer: Your access to submission nodes for Nexus computational resources is determined by your account sponsor's department, center, or lab affiliation.

Q/A.question: How are SLURM jobs submitted for both interactive and batch jobs?
Q/A.answer: SLURM jobs are submitted by either srun for interactive jobs or sbatch for batch jobs.

Q/A.question: What is the maximum wall time per job for the default job QoS in Nexus?
Q/A.answer: The maximum wall time per job for the default job QoS is 3 days.

Q/A.question: What limitations do jobs in the scavenger partition have?
Q/A.answer: Jobs in the scavenger partition have no resource limits per job, only a maximum wall time per job of 3 days.

Q/A.question: What kind of storage do users have available in their home directories in Nexus?
Q/A.answer: Users have 30GB of home directory storage available at /nfshomes/<username>.

Q/A.question: How much scratch space is allocated to users via NFS from /fs/nexus-scratch/<USERNAME>?
Q/A.answer: Users are allocated 200GB of scratch space via NFS from /fs/nexus-scratch/<USERNAME>.

Q/A.question: What type of backups and snapshots are available for project allocations in Nexus?
Q/A.answer: Project storage is fully protected, has snapshots enabled, and is backed up nightly.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to check the quota usage of your scratch space?
Q/A.answer: You can view your quota usage by running df -h /fs/nexus-scratch/<USERNAME>.

Q/A.question: What is the mandatory requirement for using the Pulse Secure VPN as of May 10th, 2019?
Q/A.answer: Enabling Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) is mandatory as of May 10th, 2019.

Q/A.question: What are the two credentials you need to provide when using the Pulse VPN multi-factor authentication?
Q/A.answer: The first credential is the UMIACS password, and the second credential is your preferred MFA verification option.

Q/A.question: What verification option do you use if you have a physical YubiKey token?
Q/A.answer: You would press the YubiKey for the one time password.

Q/A.question: What must you do to register a YubiKey for use with the VPN?
Q/A.answer: You must contact the UMIACS Tech Staff to program the YubiKey for you.

Q/A.question: Can you register hardware tokens other than YubiKeys for MFA with the VPN?
Q/A.answer: No, UMIACS only supports registering YubiKey tokens for this purpose; no other hardware token is supported.

Q/A.question: What steps should be followed to configure MFA with the Pulse VPN?
Q/A.answer: Connect with your existing Pulse VPN profile, enter your UMIACS credentials for the first authentication box, tick 'Save settings', type 'push' into the password field on the second authentication box, tick 'Save settings', and then click Connect.

Q/A.question: What will happen after you complete the MFA setup with the Pulse VPN in terms of future connections?
Q/A.answer: You should receive a push to your mobile device to complete authentication every time you connect to the VPN going forward.

Q/A.question: What are SSH keys primarily used for in the context of authentication and authorization?
Q/A.answer: SSH can utilize public key encryption to authenticate and authorize users.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended action to secure a private key when using SSH?
Q/A.answer: The private key should be secured with a pass-phrase.

Q/A.question: In what scenario are SSH keys more secure than normal passwords?
Q/A.answer: SSH keys are considered more secure than normal passwords over SSH.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of an SSH Agent according to the text?
Q/A.answer: SSH Agents allow you to temporarily use your SSH key without a password for a set period of time.

Q/A.question: What must be done to the permissions of the .ssh directory and the private key file?
Q/A.answer: The permissions of the .ssh directory should be set to 700, and the private key file should be set to 600.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to generate a new SSH key pair without a pass-phrase?
Q/A.answer: The command ssh-keygen -t rsa -N "" can be used to generate a new key without a pass-phrase.

Q/A.question: What information must be provided when using ssh-keygen to create a key pair?
Q/A.answer: It will prompt you for a file to create the private key and then for the public key append .pub extension.

Q/A.question: What warning is given regarding the private key after its creation?
Q/A.answer: Allowing anyone to read this private key will compromise the security of the key and could allow someone to access any resources secured by this key without your consent.

Q/A.question: How can the public key be copied to a remote host according to the provided information?
Q/A.answer: The public key can be copied to a remote host using the ssh-copy-id command.

Q/A.question: What must you do before creating a new key if you are using batch clusters?
Q/A.answer: If using batch clusters, please read the Batch clusters section prior to creating a new key.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of SetUID in UNIX?
Q/A.answer: SetUID is useful for programs that need root level privileges in UNIX.

Q/A.question: What command is used to export the object store credentials?
Q/A.answer: export OBJ_ACCESS_KEY_ID="<ACCESS_KEY>" export OBJ_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY="<SECRET_KEY>" export OBJ_SERVER="obj.umiacs.umd.edu"

Q/A.question: What is the size of the file 'CASIA-WebFace.tar.gz'?
Q/A.answer: 4.4GB

Q/A.question: What command is used to create a new bucket named 'janus_datasets'?
Q/A.answer: # mkobj janus_datasets:

Q/A.question: What command is used to copy 'CASIA-WebFace.tar.gz' to the bucket 'janus_datasets'?
Q/A.answer: # cpobj CASIA-WebFace.tar.gz janus_datasets:

Q/A.question: What command is used to calculate the md5sum of 'CASIA-WebFace.tar.gz' locally?
Q/A.answer: # md5sum CASIA-WebFace.tar.gz

Q/A.question: What command is used to compare the checksums between the local file and the object store?
Q/A.answer: # cmpobj janus_datasets:CASIA-WebFace.tar.gz

Q/A.question: What should the local md5sum and the md5sum from the object store do?
Q/A.answer: They should match.

Q/A.question: What command is used to find out the current quota of a user in an Isilon NAS file system?
Q/A.answer: quota

Q/A.question: What percentage of the file system was used in the example output of the df command?
What does the Use% represent in the df command output?
Q/A.answer: The Use% here is for the entire file system and not your user-specific home directory.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they encounter an error like 'Error while getting quota from ...'?
Q/A.answer: They may safely ignore these errors as some of the file systems do not report quotas correctly.

Q/A.question: What type of errors may occur if a user hits their RPC quota?
Q/A.answer: Some applications like vi may throw 'FSync' errors, and commands like wget may succeed but produce zero-length files.

Q/A.question: Which command can be used to diagnose how much space is being used in the directories?
Q/A.answer: du

Q/A.question: How can a user show their home directory quota?
Q/A.answer: By using the df command with the argument ~.

Q/A.question: Which operating systems use the concept of .. for the previous directory in the context of calculating space usage?
Q/A.answer: *NIX operating systems

Q/A.question: What command example shows how to identify all files and directories from the current directory while considering hidden files?
In the example of the du command output, how much storage is used by the Downloads directory?
What organization’s best practices does UMIACS follow regarding password usage?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS follows the best practices recommended by NIST.

Q/A.question: What does UMIACS prohibit with respect to passwords?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS prohibits the use of passwords that have been included in a known data breach.

Q/A.question: How does UMIACS verify the validity of a new password?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS checks that a new password is not among hundreds of millions of compromised passwords.

Q/A.question: What is the data source used by UMIACS for checking compromised passwords?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS uses the Have I Been Pwned (HIBP) corpus of passwords as the data source.

Q/A.question: How many compromised passwords does UMIACS check against?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS checks against hundreds of millions of compromised passwords.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended action to take regarding browser and email client updates to combat security flaws?
Q/A.answer: It is important to keep your browser and email clients up-to-date.

Q/A.question: Where can you find installers and documentation for the latest versions of Firefox and Thunderbird?
Q/A.answer: At the URLs: Firefox: http://www.getfirefox.com and Thunderbird: http://www.getthunderbird.com.

Q/A.question: How can you determine what version of Firefox or Thunderbird is installed on your computer?
Q/A.answer: By opening the application and choosing 'Help > About Mozilla [application]' on Windows or 'Firefox > About [application]' on macOS.

Q/A.question: What steps should you follow to enable automatic updates for Mozilla Firefox if it is currently disabled?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to options (Windows) or preferences (Mac), go to the Firefox Updates section, and enable the option to 'Automatically install updates'.

Q/A.question: If you want to check for updates manually in Mozilla Firefox, what is the first step?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to options (Windows) or preferences (Mac).

Q/A.question: What button must be clicked to update Firefox manually after confirming an available update?
Q/A.answer: 'Restart to Update' button (Windows and Mac).

Q/A.question: What steps are required to enable automatic updates for Mozilla Thunderbird?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to options (Windows) or preferences (Mac), go to the advanced tab, then navigate to updates, and enable 'Automatically install updates'.

Q/A.question: What must you do if Thunderbird refuses to update using the described methods?
Q/A.answer: Visit the HelpDesk for assistance from a technician.

Q/A.question: What alternative actions can be taken if auto-update is not desired in Thunderbird?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to help->about Thunderbird and click the check for updates button.

Q/A.question: When did the compute nodes from Vulcan's previous standalone cluster fold into Nexus?
Q/A.answer: The compute nodes from Vulcan's previous standalone cluster have folded into Nexus as of the scheduled maintenance window for August 2023, specifically on Thursday 08/17/2023, 5-8pm.

Q/A.question: What are the actual submission host names for logging into the Nexus cluster?
Q/A.answer: The actual submission hosts are nexusvulcan00.umiacs.umd.edu and nexusvulcan01.umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What prefix is prepended to all job parameters that were present in the standalone Vulcan cluster when moved to Nexus?
Q/A.answer: The prefix 'vulcan-' is prepended to all of the values that were present in the standalone Vulcan cluster.

Q/A.question: What is the maximum number of jobs a user can submit simultaneously in the Vulcan partition?
Q/A.answer: The max submission limit is 500 jobs per user simultaneously.

Q/A.question: How many GPU nodes are available in the Vulcan compute infrastructure, and what types of graphics cards do they run?
Q/A.answer: There are currently 46 GPU nodes available running a mixture of NVIDIA RTX A6000, A5000, A4000, Quadro P6000, GeForce GTX 1080 Ti, RTX 2080 Ti, and Tesla P100 cards.

Q/A.question: What are the roles of the 'vulcan-dpart' and 'vulcan-scavenger' partitions?
Q/A.answer: The 'vulcan-dpart' partition is the default partition where job allocations are guaranteed, while the 'vulcan-scavenger' partition allows jobs longer run times and more resources but is preemptable when jobs in other vulcan- partitions are ready to be scheduled.

Q/A.question: What is the storage limit for home directories, and what type of data should be stored there?
Q/A.answer: You have 30GB of home directory storage available at /nfshomes/<username>, which is intended to store personal or configuration files only.

Q/A.question: Which command would you use to view your account associations in the SLURM system?
Q/A.answer: $ show_assoc

Q/A.question: What happens after you request a temporary increase of scratch storage space beyond 300GB?
Q/A.answer: You will be contacted and given a one-week window of opportunity to clean and secure your data before staff will forcibly remove data to get your space back under 300GB.

Q/A.question: What is required for faculty to manage user access in the Vulcan infrastructure?
Q/A.answer: Faculty can manage this list of users via the Directory application in the Security Groups section, with the security group having the prefix 'vulcan_' followed by the faculty username.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of using local::lib in the Perl environment?
Q/A.answer: It creates an isolated collection of packages that will not affect the system version of Perl.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to creating a Perl environment as mentioned in the text?
Q/A.answer: You will first need to download a copy of local::lib.

Q/A.question: What command is used to decompress and extract the local-lib package?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'gunzip local-lib-2.000019.tar.gz' followed by 'tar xvf local-lib-2.000019.tar'.

Q/A.question: After configuring local::lib, which command should be run to install the environment?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'make test && make install'.

Q/A.question: What command should be added to the .bashrc file to initialize the new Perl environment?
Q/A.answer: The command to add is 'echo 'eval $(perl -I$HOME/perl5/lib/perl5 -Mlocal::lib)' >>~/.bashrc'.

Q/A.question: What additional file may require the initialization line for the Perl environment aside from .bashrc?
Q/A.answer: .bash_profile may also require the initialization line.

Q/A.question: Which command installs a package once the environment is created and properly sourced?
Q/A.answer: 'cpan -i Date::Tolkien::Shire' is the command used to install a package.

Q/A.question: Which command lists all the Perl Modules installed in the currently sourced environment?
Q/A.answer: 'perldoc perllocal' is the command that lists all installed Perl Modules.

Q/A.question: Where is the default directory for creating the Perl environment?
Q/A.answer: By default, the environment is created in the ~/perl5 directory.

Q/A.question: What modification is needed to create additional environments in a different directory?
Q/A.answer: You need to specify a directory while building the environment using the command 'perl Makefile.PL --bootstrap=/Path/to/Second/Environment'.

Q/A.question: What is the preferred method for providing locally-built software to the Institute according to the text?
Q/A.answer: Modules

Q/A.question: What permissions do files have by default when no umask is set?
Q/A.answer: Files have permissions 666.

Q/A.question: What binary representation corresponds to the default permission for directories when no umask is set?
Q/A.answer: Directories have permissions 777, which is 111111111 in binary.

Q/A.question: How does the umask affect the permissions of files and directories created?
Q/A.answer: For each bit that is set to 1 in the umask, the corresponding bit of any files or directories that are created is set to 0.

Q/A.question: What is the result of applying umask 022 to the default directory permissions?
Q/A.answer: The result is 755.

Q/A.question: What does umask 002 allow for user and group permissions?
Q/A.answer: It gives full rwx for the user and full rwx for the group, and r-x for others.

Q/A.question: What is the risk associated with using umask 000?
Q/A.answer: It gives full control to user, group, and others, making the directory or file world read, write, and executable, which can be a large security risk.

Q/A.question: Which command is used to set or check the current umask in a shell?
Q/A.answer: The command used is umask.

Q/A.question: Where can you set your umask to be applied by default each time you start a new shell session?
Q/A.answer: In your shell initialization file, such as .profile or .bash_profile for bash, and .cshrc or .tcshrc for tcsh.

Q/A.question: What command can be added to .bash_profile to set the umask to 002?
Q/A.answer: The command to add is 'echo 'umask 002' >> ~/.bash_profile'.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of this article?
Q/A.answer: The article is about how to manually force Microsoft Office to activate and obtain a license from the university KMS server.

Q/A.question: Under what circumstances will a user need to manually activate Microsoft Office?
Q/A.answer: A user will need to manually activate Microsoft Office if it is installed on a host that goes an extended length of time (180 days or more) without connecting to the campus network (either physically or through a VPN) and needs to be activated in a hurry.

Q/A.question: What network connections are necessary to activate Microsoft Office?
Q/A.answer: To activate Microsoft Office, you need to be connected to either the wired campus network, campus WiFi, the campus VPN, or the UMIACS VPN.

Q/A.question: What must be correct for the activation process to work?
Q/A.answer: Your time must be correct (i.e. set via the Internet) and set to the US Eastern timezone for this to work.

Q/A.answer: You can run the command 'w32tm /resync' on the command line to resync your time.

Q/A.answer: The first step in the Simple Activation Method is to open any Office product (Word, PowerPoint, etc.).

Q/A.question: What command do you need to run to set the KMS server for 64-bit Office on 64-bit Windows?
Q/A.answer: The command to set the KMS server for 64-bit Office on 64-bit Windows is 'cscript "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Office16\OSPP.VBS" /sethst:kms.umd.edu'.

Q/A.question: What is the command used to check the licensing status of Microsoft Office?
Q/A.answer: The command used to check the licensing status is 'cscript "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Office16\OSPP.VBS" /dstatus'.

Q/A.question: What does the command 'cscript "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Office16\OSPP.VBS" /act' do?
Q/A.answer: The command 'cscript "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Office16\OSPP.VBS" /act' forces an activation against the KMS server.

Q/A.answer: The command outputs the content of $PBS_NODEFILE.

Q/A.question: What is recommended for storing large or heavily accessed datasets?
Q/A.answer: It is recommended to store large or heavily accessed datasets in a dedicated project storage directory that is tuned for your application.

Q/A.question: Why is it suggested to separate project data from personal data?
Q/A.answer: Separating project data from personal data will simplify administration and data management for both researchers and staff.

Q/A.question: What operating systems are covered by the UMIACS institutional Matlab licenses?
Q/A.answer: Linux, Windows, and macOS.

Q/A.question: What versions of Matlab are supported by the University's license server?
Q/A.answer: Only Matlab versions R2020a and newer are supported.

Q/A.question: How can one install the institutional version of Matlab on a self-supported machine?
Q/A.answer: By contacting staff to provide install media.

Q/A.question: What is the preferred way to interact with Matlab on UMIACS-supported Linux machines?
Q/A.answer: Modules are the preferred way.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you need a later version of Matlab on a UMIACS-supported Windows machine?
Q/A.answer: Contact staff if you would like a later version installed.

Q/A.question: What is required to use the University's Matlab licenses?
Q/A.answer: You must have network connectivity.

Q/A.question: What happens when calling functions in a toolbox in Matlab?
Q/A.answer: Matlab will automatically check out a license for that toolbox, making it temporarily unavailable to other users.

Q/A.question: What is indicated by a license manager error stating that the maximum number of users for Matlab has been reached?
Q/A.answer: This likely indicates that all of campus' available licenses are in use.

Q/A.question: How can you specify a path other than the current working directory for startup and 3rd party toolbox locations in Matlab?
Q/A.answer: By using the userpath environment variable.

Q/A.answer: New accounts, approve requests, etc.

Q/A.question: What can users do in the Search the Directory section?
Q/A.answer: Search for e-mail addresses, telephone numbers, and room numbers of UMIACS employees.

Q/A.question: What options are available in the Directory Update section?
Q/A.answer: Update your UMIACS directory info and change e-mail forwarding options.

Q/A.question: What type of information is available in the Technical Reference section?
Q/A.answer: How-to's and FAQ's regarding UMIACS's computing facilities.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the Equipment Reservation section?
Q/A.answer: Reserve laptops and other equipment ahead of time.

Q/A.question: What is the main purpose of the UMIACS Certificate Authority?
Q/A.answer: The main purpose of the UMIACS Certificate Authority is to enable web browsers to trust UMIACS's secure webpages.

Q/A.question: What steps must be followed in Windows to accept the UMIACS certificate after downloading it?
Q/A.answer: After downloading the UMIACS Certificate Authority file, open it, click 'Install Certificate', then 'Next', choose 'Place all certificates in the following store', click 'Browse', select 'Trusted Root Certification Authorities', click 'Ok', then 'Next', and 'Finish'. If a Security Warning appears, click 'Yes'.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they do not have administrator access on a UMIACS-supported Mac?
Q/A.answer: If a user does not have administrator access on a UMIACS-supported Mac, they should contact Staff.

Q/A.question: In macOS, where is the Keychain Access located?
Q/A.answer: Keychain Access is located in the Others group in Launchpad.

Q/A.question: What must be done after right-clicking the added certificate in macOS?
Q/A.answer: After right-clicking the added certificate, the user must select the 'Get Info' section and then select 'Always Trust' in the 'When using this certificate' dropdown.

Q/A.question: What is a prerequisite for accepting the UMIACS Certificate Authority in macOS?
Q/A.answer: Administrator access is required to accept the UMIACS Certificate Authority in macOS.

Q/A.question: What may a Unix user need assistance with regarding the UMIACS Certificate Authority?
Q/A.answer: A Unix user may need assistance with the more complicated process of accepting the UMIACS Certificate Authority, which may depend on their particular Unix distribution.

Q/A.question: What is the first step for accepting the UMIACS certificate in most Windows browsers?
Q/A.answer: The first step is to click the UMIACS Certificate Authority link to download the file.

Q/A.question: What action do you need to perform after entering administrator credentials in macOS?
Q/A.answer: After entering administrator credentials, the user should close the certificate and Keychain Access window.

Q/A.question: What browser is mentioned as being an exception in the macOS instructions for accepting the UMIACS certificate?
Q/A.answer: Firefox is mentioned as the exception in the macOS instructions.

Q/A.question: What should a user do first if they haven't already when attempting to recover Duo authentication?
Q/A.answer: Download the Duo app on your device.

Q/A.question: Where should a user navigate to in order to log in with their UMIACS credentials?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to https://intranet.umiacs.umd.edu/directory.

Q/A.question: What button should a user click on the Duo prompt after logging in?
Q/A.answer: Click the 'My Settings & Devices' button on the left.

Q/A.question: What are the two options a user can select to authenticate without the Duo app?
Q/A.answer: The Call Me or Passcode option.

Q/A.question: What should a user click on their registered device to reactivate Duo Mobile?
Q/A.answer: Click Device Options.

Q/A.question: What action must a user follow after clicking Reactivate Duo Mobile?
Q/A.answer: Follow the on-screen prompts.

Q/A.question: What email address do members of a Mailman list use to post messages?
Q/A.answer: list-name@lists.umiacs.umd.edu

Q/A.question: What steps are involved in adding users to a mailing list using the Mass Subscription feature?
Q/A.answer: Log in to the mailing list's administration page with the admin password, click 'Membership Management...' -> Choose 'Mass Subscription'. Enter one address per line of users you would like to subscribe. Click 'Submit Your Changes' button and verify by choosing 'Membership List' under 'Membership Management...'

Q/A.question: How can someone subscribe to a mailing list without the administrator's assistance?
Q/A.answer: They just need to go to http://lists.umiacs.umd.edu/mailman/listinfo/LISTNAME and fill in the form or send an email to LISTNAME-subscribe.

Q/A.question: What should an administrator do to automatically delete all mail from non-members?
Q/A.answer: Go to the privacy page followed by the sender-filter sub-page and set to 'discard' the value for 'Action to take for postings from non-members for which no explicit action is defined.'

Q/A.question: How can a user post from multiple addresses to a 'members-only' mailing list without their message being rejected?
Q/A.answer: The solution is to subscribe both addresses to the list but to disable delivery from all but one of the addresses.

Q/A.question: How can an administrator change a member's password or send it to them?
Q/A.answer: Go to the Membership Management page, click the address in question, and use the option 'Email my password to me'.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the moderation flag in a mailing list?
Q/A.answer: The moderation flag is used to manage posts from users, allowing the list administrator to set users as moderated or to reject their posts by default.

Q/A.question: What action must an administrator take to unsubscribe users without them receiving an unsubscribe message?
Q/A.answer: They need to click the 'unsub' button next to each user's name or go to the Mass Removal subpage and add all addresses before clicking 'submit'.

Q/A.question: What feature is used to edit a held message before approving it for a mailing list?
Q/A.answer: Use the 'forward this message' feature in the admindb page to forward the message to yourself, edit it, and resend it to the list with the appropriate headers.

Q/A.question: What common spam filter restriction is mentioned for mailing lists?
Q/A.answer: One common spam filter restriction is to restrict posts with [QUAR] in the subject.

Q/A.question: What software is needed to complete the loaner form digitally?
Q/A.answer: Adobe Acrobat DC or Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.

Q/A.question: Where can Adobe Acrobat DC be accessed for free?
Q/A.answer: From Terpware.

Q/A.question: What should be clicked on the top menu to begin filling out the loaner form?
Q/A.answer: Tools.

Q/A.question: What minimum field must be filled out for each item on the loaner form?
Q/A.answer: Description of Equipment.

Q/A.question: What must users do with the signature field before saving the form?
Q/A.answer: Leave the signature field blank.

Q/A.question: What happens after saving the PDF with the signature placed in the signature field?
Q/A.answer: Users will not be able to edit the form further.

Q/A.question: What should the file be renamed to include before saving it?
Q/A.answer: The word 'signed'.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of attaching the signed form?
Q/A.answer: To attach it to the originating request that prompted staff to direct you to this page.

Q/A.question: What is the reason a job remains in the Pending state if it has a lower priority than another pending job?
Q/A.answer: Your job gets assigned a lower priority value than that pending job; your job will instead remain in the Pending state with reason (Priority).

Q/A.question: What command can be used to provide a time estimate for when a job will start?
Q/A.answer: The command squeue -j <jobid> --start can be used to provide a time estimate for when your job will start.

Q/A.question: What are the priority factors in use at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The priority factors include: Age of job, Association (SLURM account), Partition job was submitted to, Fair-share of resources, and 'Nice' value that job was submitted with.

Q/A.question: How does the Age factor affect a job's priority?
Q/A.answer: The longer a job is eligible to run but cannot due to resources being unavailable, the higher the job's priority becomes as it continues to wait in the queue. The priority modifier for this factor reaches its limit after 7 days.

Q/A.question: What is the general priority order for partitions at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: In decreasing order of priority, the priority tiers for partitions are: Account-specific non-preemptable partitions, Lab/center-specific non-'scavenger' named partitions, Lab/center-specific 'scavenger' named partitions, Institute-wide scavenger partition.

Q/A.question: What impact does Fair-share have on job priority within the same account?
Q/A.answer: The more resources your jobs have already consumed within an account, the lower priority factor your future jobs will have when compared to other users' jobs in the same account who have used fewer resources.

Q/A.question: What is the weighting value of memory in CPU-only partition billing?
Q/A.answer: The weighting value for memory is 1.0 per GB, resulting in roughly 90.9% of the billing weight being for memory and 9.1% being for CPU.

Q/A.question: How is the 'Nice' value used when submitting jobs, and how does it affect their priority?
Q/A.answer: 'Nice' is a submission argument included to deprioritize jobs; larger values will deprioritize jobs more.

Q/A.question: What is the baseline GPU type currently used for weighting in GPU partitions at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The current baseline GPU is the NVIDIA RTX A4000.

Q/A.question: What happens to jobs submitted to the scavenger partition at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Jobs submitted to the scavenger partition always have a lower priority factor for their jobs than all other partitions on that cluster and are also preemptable.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to view Fair-share statistics?
Q/A.answer: The command sshare -l can be used to view the various fair-share statistics.

Q/A.question: What defines a User-Supported system according to the document?
Q/A.answer: A User-Supported system is any University owned hardware that is administered by the system's primary user.

Q/A.question: What types of services may UMIACS Technical Staff provide on User-Supported systems?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS Technical Staff may provide In-Warranty hardware diagnostics and support, operating system and software licensing and media.

Q/A.question: Who is responsible for the maintenance, security, and backups of a User-Supported system?
Q/A.answer: The maintenance, security, and backups of the system will be the responsibility of its primary user.

Q/A.question: What is the reason given for no longer supporting MongoDB?
Q/A.answer: Changes in their licensing a few years ago.

Q/A.question: What type of file should be downloaded from the MongoDB Community download page for installation?
Q/A.answer: The right Community Server file, which for most people will be: Version: Current, Platform: RedHat / CentOS 7.0, Package: tgz.

Q/A.question: What must be created as part of the MongoDB installation steps?
Q/A.answer: A custom mongod.conf configuration file.

Q/A.question: What are the specific directories that need to be set in the custom mongod.conf file?
Q/A.answer: systemPath and dbPath, which must be directories that you own.

Q/A.question: What command is used to start the mongo server with the custom configuration file?
Q/A.answer: "/path/to/bin/mongod --config /path/to/mongod.conf".

Q/A.question: How do you stop the mongo server after you are done using it?
Q/A.answer: "/path/to/bin/mongod --config /path/to/mongod.conf --shutdown".

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they wish to subscribe to a private list?
Q/A.answer: They need to go to http://lists.umiacs.umd.edu/mailman/listinfo/LISTNAME, even if the list is private, and they can also subscribe/unsubscribe by email.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the password provided by UMIACS staff?
Q/A.answer: The password is needed for managing the list, including adding/removing users, approving user subscriptions, and tailoring the list.

Q/A.question: What capability does the 'Membership Management' section provide?
Q/A.answer: This section allows you to subscribe and unsubscribe users, hide their email addresses, and more.

Q/A.question: How can a list administrator set the list to be moderated?
Q/A.answer: A list can be set to be moderated at the bottom of the 'Membership Management' --> 'Membership List' page.

Q/A.question: What happens when a user forgets their password in the Membership Management section?
Q/A.answer: Clicking on the user's email address will allow the administrator to send them an email message containing their password.

Q/A.question: What is the default visibility setting for list membership email addresses?
Q/A.answer: By default, only list members can see the email addresses of other list members.

Q/A.question: What is the significance of the 'Archiving Options' section?
Q/A.answer: This section allows the administrator to choose whether or not to archive messages sent to the list and who can access those archives.

Q/A.question: What confirmation process is required when a new user tries to subscribe to the list?
Q/A.answer: Mailman sends a confirm email message to the user asking if they are sure they want to subscribe.

Q/A.question: What can a list administrator do in the event of messages pending moderation?
Q/A.answer: They can view the queue of messages and choose actions such as Defer, Accept, Reject, or Discard for messages.

Q/A.question: What does the 'nomail' option do for a user who goes on vacation?
Q/A.answer: The 'nomail' option turns off mailing to that individual until they return.

Q/A.question: What is the default group membership for a UMIACS account?
Q/A.answer: Each UMIACS account is by default a member of its own group, defined by that username.

Q/A.question: How many UNIX groups can a user create via the Directory tool?
Q/A.answer: A user may create up to 5 UNIX groups via the Directory tool.

Q/A.question: What must a user do to add a valid UMIACS user to a newly created UNIX group?
Q/A.answer: Click on the link of the newly created group, add a valid UMIACS user into the available text box, and click add user.

Q/A.question: Which command is used to grant group ownership of a file to a specific UNIX group?
Q/A.answer: The command to use is chgrp group-name file-name.

Q/A.question: How can a user verify the permissions that a group has for a specific file or directory?
Q/A.answer: To see the permissions that the group has, a user can use the command ls -l, and the group permissions will be the 5, 6, 7th characters of the permissions listing.

Q/A.question: What command should be used to change the permissions of a group on a file or directory?
Q/A.answer: To change the permissions of the group, use chmod g+r/w/x file-name if you own the group.

Q/A.question: How are group deletions managed at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Deleting groups will be managed by UMIACS staff, and a ticket must be submitted through JIRA to delete a group.

Q/A.question: What is Tensorflow and which company developed it?
Q/A.answer: Tensorflow is a Python deep learning package developed by Google.

Q/A.question: What is the preferred way to install Tensorflow according to the text?
Q/A.answer: The easiest way to install Tensorflow is to build a Python virtualenv with it in it.

Q/A.question: What specific Tensorflow version is mentioned as the latest release as of April 29, 2024?
Q/A.answer: The latest Tensorflow release mentioned is tensorflow-2.16.1.

Q/A.question: What command should be used to create a Python virtualenv for Tensorflow?

Q/A.answer: (env) $ pip install --upgrade tensorflow

Q/A.answer: TF-TRT Warning: Could not find TensorRT.

Q/A.answer: It is needed to export specific flags in the shell for using XLA with Tensorflow.

Q/A.answer: The activation function used is tf.nn.softmax.

Q/A.question: What happens to the visibility of your bucket when you set up a website configuration?
Q/A.answer: Setting up a website configuration will automatically set the visibility of your bucket to public and remove the bucket level ACLs.

Q/A.question: What action must be taken to remove a website configuration using the web interface?

Q/A.question: For how long does UMIACS archive data?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS archives data for a period of 5 years.

Q/A.question: What types of data does UMIACS generally archive?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS generally archives persistent local data from primary drives on UMIACS-supported machines (Windows/macOS only) and data from accounts that are closed (metadata, network home directories, GitLab repositories, etc.).

Q/A.question: What are the types of data that UMIACS does not archive?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS does not archive /tmp and /scratch directories, temporary project directories, external drives attached to a UMIACS-supported machine, data migrated from one UMIACS-supported machine to another, data handed off to the end-user or PI via external drive, data from drives that failed and were not under backup protection, and any data from self-supported machines.

Q/A.question: Which operating systems are supported for archiving persistent local data?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS supports Windows and macOS for archiving persistent local data.

Q/A.question: What happens to data from accounts that are closed at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Data from accounts that are closed, such as metadata, network home directories, and GitLab repositories, is archived.

Q/A.question: What control device is used to manage the video and audio sources in conference room ATL 3100A?
Q/A.answer: A touch panel.

Q/A.question: What types of sources can be projected in conference room ATL 3100A?
Q/A.answer: Room PC, Solstice Pod, and an HDMI cable to use a laptop or external device.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the 'Audio Override' output device in conference room ATL 3100A?
Q/A.answer: It decouples the source audio from the source video, allowing audio from one source to be sent to the audio output while maintaining video from a different source.

Q/A.question: What should users do with the Conference account on the room PC once they are finished using it?

Q/A.question: Is there support for NFSv4 at UMIACS?

Q/A.question: What must a user ensure before attempting to reserve a room through Google Calendar?

Q/A.question: What is a virtual environment in Python?
Q/A.answer: A virtual environment is an isolated working copy of Python, which allows you to work on specific projects without affecting others.

Q/A.question: What is the intended purpose of huddle rooms?

Q/A.answer: Mersive Solstice, Laptop via HDMI or Mersive Solstice Pod.

Q/A.answer: All students within the class will need to raise issues or questions through the faculty member or TA(s) as the point of contacts.

Q/A.question: What should a student do if they did not provide a phone number when redeeming their account?
Q/A.answer: If a student does not provide a phone number when they redeem their account, the TA will need to contact staff for assistance with password reset.

Q/A.question: When are class accounts typically deleted after the completion of a semester?
Q/A.answer: Class accounts are liable to be archived and deleted as early as February 1st for Winter semesters, June 1st for Spring semesters, September 1st for Summer semesters, and January 1st of the next year for Fall semesters.

Q/A.question: Which two institutions are partners in QuICS?
Q/A.answer: The partners in QuICS are the University of Maryland (UMD) and the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).

Q/A.answer: QuICS is located at the University of Maryland just outside of Washington, D.C.
