Q/A.answer: QuICS advances research and education in quantum computer science and quantum information theory.

Q/A.question: What does the acronym NIST stand for?
Q/A.answer: NIST stands for the National Institute of Standards and Technology.

Q/A.question: What is Solstice and what does it enable users to do?
Q/A.answer: Solstice is a wireless and content sharing solution that enables multiple users to connect simultaneously to a shared display using laptops and mobile devices over an existing wireless network without the need for cables or additional hardware.

Q/A.question: Which buildings are equipped with Solstice Mersive Pods?
Q/A.answer: All conference rooms in the Brendan Iribe Center and some in the Atlantic Building are equipped with Solstice Mersive Pods.

Q/A.question: What information can be found on the Welcome Screen of a Solstice display?
Q/A.answer: The Welcome Screen contains the Solstice display name, a screen key, network information, user connection instructions, and the Solstice display menu.

Q/A.question: What steps should be followed to connect to a Solstice display using the Solstice user app?
Q/A.answer: To connect to a Solstice display using the Solstice user app, ensure you are connected to either the UMD wireless or wired network, search for a specific display by name/IP in the search bar, and when prompted, enter the screen key listed on the Solstice display.

Q/A.question: How can a user mirror their iOS device screen to a Solstice display using AirPlay?

Q/A.question: What should a user do if the desired Solstice display does not appear in the AirPlay menu?

Q/A.question: What capability does Miracast provide for Windows devices in relation to Solstice displays?

Q/A.answer: A user should hit the Windows key + P to connect their Windows laptop to a wireless display.

Q/A.question: What is the Mersive recommendation for the setting to use when streaming with Miracast?
Q/A.answer: Mersive recommends using the Duplicate setting when streaming with Miracast.

Q/A.question: How can a user stop Miracast streaming to a Solstice display?
Q/A.answer: To stop Miracast streaming to the display, the user should hit the Windows key + P, click Connect to a wireless display, then click Disconnect.

Q/A.question: What service administrates the wireless network on the campus?

Q/A.answer: The Network Troubleshooting section addresses basic network issues.

Q/A.question: Who is allowed to run non-interruptible jobs on the GAMMA lab GPU nodes?

Q/A.question: What type of additional job Quality of Service (QoS) does the GAMMA partition offer?

Q/A.answer: The GrpTRES limit is 100% of the available cores/RAM on the partition-specific nodes in aggregate plus 50% of the available cores/RAM on legacy nodes in aggregate.

Q/A.answer: A user must include the Project Name, Description, Size, Length in days, and other users that need to access the allocation, if any.

Q/A.question: What built-in backup tool does the article focus on for creating personal backups on Windows devices?

Q/A.question: What type of drive is required for creating personal backups according to the prerequisites section?
Q/A.answer: A portable hard drive formatted with the NTFS file system.

Q/A.question: What edition of Windows is necessary to use the backup procedure mentioned in the article?
Q/A.answer: Any desktop edition of Windows 10/11.

Q/A.question: How frequently does File History back up files by default?
Q/A.answer: Every one hour.

Q/A.question: What happens if the portable hard drive is disconnected for 5 days or more?
Q/A.answer: You will receive a Windows notification, and backups will automatically resume upon reconnecting the drive.

Q/A.question: What action must be taken to include or exclude folders in the backup process?
Q/A.answer: Click on More options.

Q/A.question: What is the recommendation regarding the security of backups mentioned in the overview section?
Q/A.answer: We strongly encourage encrypting your backups.

Q/A.question: Where can you find instructions on how to prepare an encrypted portable hard drive for backups?

Q/A.question: What default folders does File History backup when it is enabled?

Q/A.question: What type of storage refers to data physically stored at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Local (data) storage.

Q/A.question: What is the maximum quota allocated to each user for the network home directory local storage?
Q/A.answer: 30GB, non-expandable Quota.

Q/A.question: How is user data backed up in UNIX local storage?
Q/A.answer: User directories use redundant, backed-up network file shares.

Q/A.question: What directories in UNIX local storage may not be used for permanent storage of unique, important data?
Q/A.answer: /tmp, /scratch0, /scratch1, and any directory named in whole or in part 'tmp', 'temp', or 'scratch'.

Q/A.question: What happens to user directories when a host is decommissioned in the Windows and macOS local storage section?
Q/A.answer: User directories go into the Archives.

Q/A.question: Which local storage option does UMIACS discourage due to high vulnerability to data loss or theft?
Q/A.answer: Direct-attached local storage.

Q/A.question: What is the naming convention for network-attached local storage shares dedicated for datasets and project storage?
Q/A.answer: /fs/<lab>-<purpose> (i.e., /fs/cml-models or /fs/vulcan-projects).

Q/A.question: Are network-attached local scratch storage shares backed up or archived by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: No, network-attached local scratch storage is not backed up or archived by UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What CLI command shows current memory (RAM) usage and can display this information in a human-readable format?
Q/A.answer: free -h.

Q/A.question: What should users do if they find network-attached local storage space documentation that does not state its retention policy?
Q/A.answer: Contact staff.

Q/A.question: What is the primary function of the centralized print server used by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: To manage all of the printers in the Institute.

Q/A.question: What should be used in the printer queue naming scheme if a printer is in building number 432?
Q/A.answer: The name should include '432-' after the type of printer.

Q/A.question: In the naming scheme for printer queues, what letter represents color printers?
Q/A.answer: 'c' represents color printers.

Q/A.question: What is the default type of printer indicated in the naming scheme?
Q/A.answer: Black & white is the default, so nothing extra is needed.

Q/A.question: What are the two types of printer drivers mentioned, and how do they affect naming?
Q/A.answer: PostScript and PCL are the two types of printer drivers, with 'ps' for PostScript-enabled queues and 'pcl' for Printer Command Language-enabled queues.

Q/A.question: If a printer is located in room 3208 of building 432, how would its queue be named?
Q/A.answer: The queue would be named 'ps432-3208' if it is black & white.

Q/A.question: What is the example name for a color printer located in Atlantic building room 3261?
Q/A.answer: The example name is 'cps224-3261'.

Q/A.question: Why should someone use 'ps' for PostScript if they are unsure about the printer driver options?
Q/A.answer: Because PCL drivers may not always be available.

Q/A.question: What type of support does UMIACS provide for university-owned systems?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS provides hardware and operating system (OS) support for university-owned systems across its various labs and centers.

Q/A.question: What services are included under Hardware Services at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The Hardware Services at UMIACS include in-warranty hardware diagnostic and replacement and Hardware Integration.

Q/A.question: List two services provided under Operating System Services by UMIACS.
Q/A.answer: Two services provided under Operating System Services by UMIACS are OS Deployment and Security Updates.

Q/A.question: Why is it critical to create a Service Admin User before taking an Apple product to the Terrapin Tech store?
Q/A.answer: Technicians at the store require an admin user name and password, and if the pre-existing password is the same as your UMIACS domain login password, revealing it to the technicians would represent a security vulnerability.

Q/A.question: What must you do to create a new temporary user account with administrator privileges?
Q/A.answer: Make sure you are logged in to an administrator account on your MacBook, navigate to System Preferences, select 'Users and Groups', click on the 'Add User' button, select 'Administrator' from the 'New User' dropdown menu, set the full name to 'Service Admin', and the account name to 'serviceadmin'.

Q/A.question: What should the password for the new Service Admin account be?
Q/A.answer: The password is up to you, so long as it's not the same as your UMIACS account password or your UMD Directory ID password.

Q/A.question: What action should you take after the service is completed?
Q/A.answer: Once the service is completed, the account can be deleted.

Q/A.question: What credentials should you provide to the technician when prompted by the Terrapin Tech store?
Q/A.answer: You should give this account's credentials to the technician, not your UMIACS account credentials.

Q/A.question: What versions of Cuda are required when compiling Torch?
Q/A.answer: You have to use Cuda 8 or Cuda 7.5 when compiling Torch.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you encounter issues while compiling Torch?
Q/A.answer: You should contact staff if you have issues, as there are some local packages that are required and could cause the install to fail.

Q/A.answer: The software to load includes cuda/8.0.61, cudnn, zeromq, nodejs, sox, and GraphicsMagick.

Q/A.question: What command is used to create and activate a Python environment assuming the use of the bash shell?
Q/A.answer: The commands are 'virtualenv env' followed by 'source env/bin/activate'.

Q/A.question: What two dependencies are installed after upgrading the python pip package manager?
Q/A.answer: The two dependencies are pyzmq and ipython.

Q/A.question: What is the command to clone the Torch repository with all its sub-dependencies?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'git clone https://github.com/torch/distro.git torch --recursive'.

Q/A.question: What command is run to build Torch after changing the directory to the torch folder?
Q/A.answer: The command is './install.sh'.

Q/A.question: What command is provided as an example to activate the Torch environment?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'source install/bin/torch-activate'.

Q/A.question: What is the content of the file 'torch_test.th' used to test the installation of Torch?
Q/A.answer: The contents are: a = torch.Tensor(5,3); a = torch.rand(5,3); b = torch.rand(3,4); c = torch.Tensor(5,4); c:mm(a,b); print(c); require 'cutorch'; a = a:cuda(); b = b:cuda(); c = c:cuda(); c:mm(a,b); print(c).

Q/A.question: What is required for all accounts in the Nexus and UMIACS accounts?
Q/A.answer: All accounts in the Nexus (and UMIACS accounts in general) are required to be sponsored.

Q/A.question: How can new accounts be requested according to the text?
Q/A.answer: New accounts can be requested via the Requests application.

Q/A.question: Who can use the Requests application to request new accounts for themselves?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS and CSD faculty members can use the Requests application to request new accounts for themselves.

Q/A.question: Who should be listed as the Principal Investigator when faculty members are filling out the Requests application?
Q/A.answer: The username of the current Director of Computing Facilities at UMIACS, who is currently derek, should be listed as the Principal Investigator.

Q/A.question: What is the time frame for account installation after approval from the Director of Computing Facilities?
Q/A.answer: The account will be installed within 24 business hours (9am-5pm M-F).

Q/A.question: What must students do when requesting an account as directed by a faculty member?
Q/A.answer: Students or collaborators must use the UMIACS account username of the UMIACS or CSD faculty member as the Principal Investigator.

Q/A.question: What happens if a faculty sponsor leaves UMIACS/CSD or revokes sponsorship of an account?
Q/A.answer: You will be given 30 days to find a new account sponsor, and if this 30 days lapse, your account will be archived and removed.

Q/A.question: What does Duo provide for UMD centralized information technology resources and UMIACS local resources?
Q/A.answer: Duo is the multi-factor authentication (MFA) solution for both UMD centralized information technology resources (DivIT) and UMIACS local resources.

Q/A.question: What are the two components that multi-factor solutions ensure for authentication?
Q/A.answer: Something you know (i.e. your password) and something you have (phone/tablet/token).

Q/A.question: What must users do individually for UMD and UMIACS regarding Duo enrollment?
Q/A.answer: Enrollment is discrete and must be done for both UMD (if you have a UMD appointment) and UMIACS individually.

Q/A.question: Can the same hardware token be used for both UMD and UMIACS services?
Q/A.answer: No, the same hardware token cannot be used; you can enroll the same phone for both services but not the same hardware token.

Q/A.question: What actions may be taken if a Duo authentication factor is shared with another UMIACS user?
Q/A.answer: Action may be taken against your account if you share a registered Duo authentication factor with any other UMIACS user.

Q/A.question: Which devices are suggested for seamless enrollment with Duo?
Q/A.answer: Users are encouraged to enroll with their smartphone as it provides the most seamless experience.

Q/A.question: What should you do before disposing of a currently registered phone or tablet?
Q/A.answer: You should consider enrolling your new device before getting rid of your old device.

Q/A.question: What options are available for generating one-time codes when phone data or calls are not available?
Q/A.answer: You may use the Duo App on your phone or tablet to generate one-time codes or use YubiKey hardware tokens.

Q/A.question: What services are secured with the Duo MFA solution?
Q/A.answer: The following UMIACS services are secured with Duo: GitLab, Jira, Object Storage, VPN, Directory, Requests, MediaWiki log ins, and SSH (when coming in from off-campus).

Q/A.question: What should users create to work around issues cloning HTTPS Git repositories in GitLab due to Duo's requirements?
Q/A.answer: Users should set up an SSH key instead of using UMIACS credentials directly for accessing HTTPS Git repositories.

Q/A.question: What command shows job status in the queue?
Q/A.answer: The squeue command shows job status in the queue.

Q/A.question: Which flag would you use with the squeue command to show only your jobs?
Q/A.answer: -u username to show only your jobs.

Q/A.question: What does the --start flag do in the squeue command?
Q/A.answer: --start estimates start time for a job that has not yet started and the reason why it is waiting.

Q/A.question: What is displayed if you do not specify a job step when using the sstat command?
Q/A.answer: If you don't specify a job step, the lowest job step is displayed.

Q/A.question: What type of information does the sacct command provide?
Q/A.answer: The sacct command shows metrics from past jobs.

Q/A.question: What is indicated by the 'PD' status when checking running jobs?
Q/A.answer: 'PD' indicates that the job is in Pending status.

Q/A.question: How can you determine the reason why a job is in a Pending state?
Q/A.answer: You can determine the reason by looking at the NODELIST parameter or by using the scontrol show job <jobid> command.

Q/A.question: What does the 'Resources' reason indicate when a job is in the PD state?
Q/A.answer: It indicates that the cluster does not currently have the resources to fit your job in your selected partition.

Q/A.question: What command would you use to check the current reservations in SLURM?
Q/A.answer: You would use the scontrol show reservation command to check the current reservations.

Q/A.question: What should you do if your requested TimeLimit conflicts with a maintenance reservation?
Q/A.answer: You can lower your TimeLimit so that the job will complete before the reservation begins, or leave your job to wait until the reservation completes.

Q/A.question: What should you do if the conference room PC is already signed into the desktop?
Q/A.answer: Sign out of the desktop and then sign in again to ensure a clean slate.

Q/A.question: How long will it take for the conference room PC to automatically sign out due to inactivity?
Q/A.answer: It will automatically sign out after 8 hours of inactivity.

Q/A.question: Which account should be selected when logging into the conference room PC?
Q/A.answer: Select the Conference account.

Q/A.question: What steps are required to log into Zoom using UMD credentials?
Q/A.answer: Click on 'Sign in with SSO', type in 'umd' under company domain, and click 'Continue'.

Q/A.question: What information is required to join an existing Zoom meeting?
Q/A.answer: A meeting ID (usually a 10-11 digit number) or a personal link.

Q/A.question: How can you invite others to your Zoom meeting?
Q/A.answer: Click on 'participants' at the bottom, then click the 'invite' button, and finally click the 'Copy Invitation' button.

Q/A.question: What action must be taken to connect Zoom audio using the lectern microphone?
Q/A.answer: Unmute the mic and unmute yourself on Zoom.

Q/A.question: What should you adjust in Zoom settings to display video from a personal laptop?
Q/A.answer: Select 'laptop', then route it to shared video and/or projector or monitor.

Q/A.question: What to do after the Zoom meeting regarding the Conference account?
Q/A.answer: Sign out of the Conference account and shut down the A/V system.

Q/A.question: What is GNU Screen and what functionality does it provide?
Q/A.answer: GNU Screen, or 'screen', is a window management program that allows multiplexing of a single terminal between multiple virtual consoles and can separate programs from the shell to keep them running even if the connection to the host is lost.

Q/A.question: When is it typically advantageous to use Screen?
Q/A.answer: Screen is typically used when a network connection is unstable and the process must remain running even if an SSH connection has dropped, or when a process is slow and other processes need to be running.

Q/A.question: How can you start editing a file named program.c using Screen in the vi editor?
Q/A.answer: You can start editing the file program.c in vi by using the command '# screen vi program.c'.

Q/A.question: What command would you use to detach from the current screen session?
Q/A.answer: You would use the command '# screen -d' to detach from the current screen session.

Q/A.question: What would the output of '# screen -ls' look like if there are two detached sessions?
Q/A.answer: The output would be similar to: '# There are screens on:#  26598.screenTest1 (Detached)#  18457.pts-0.tron02 (Detached)# 2 Sockets in /var/run/screen/S-username.'

Q/A.question: What is the function of the Ctrl-A + k command in Screen?
Q/A.answer: The Ctrl-A + k command is used to kill the current window in Screen.

Q/A.question: What happens to a screen session when a program running in a single window exits?
Q/A.answer: When a program running in a screen session that has only one window exits, the screen session will terminate as well.

Q/A.question: What customization can be done using the .screenrc file in a user's home directory?
Q/A.answer: The .screenrc file can be used to customize a screen session's startup behavior by executing commands upon starting screen, such as displaying the window number and name or altering key sequences for screen commands.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the Ctrl-A + ' command in Screen?
Q/A.answer: The Ctrl-A + ' command presents a selection of screen windows from which to choose.

Q/A.question: Where can you find a full list of Ctrl-A commands?
Q/A.answer: A full list of Ctrl-A commands can be found in the documentation available at the GNU Screen manual link.

Q/A.question: What is Podman and how does it differ from Docker in terms of user namespaces?
Q/A.answer: Podman is a daemonless container engine alternative to Docker, and it has the ability to run containers in user namespaces, allowing processes within a namespace to map to a new uid/gid range, unlike Docker which grants trivial administrative control over the host.

Q/A.question: What issues arise when using Podman with home directories available over NFS?
Q/A.answer: When using Podman with home directories available over NFS, there is an issue that due to user name space mapping, users will not be able to access their home directory while building layers.

Q/A.question: In the context of Podman, what command should a user run if they encounter an error about no subuid ranges on their workstation?
Q/A.answer: A user should contact staff with the error message and the host that they are using if they receive an error like 'cannot find mappings for user username: No subuid ranges found for user "username" in /etc/subuid'.

Q/A.question: What is the default location for storing container image layers in Podman, and where should it be updated if using NFS?
Q/A.answer: The default location for storing container image layers in Podman is specified in the graphroot setting of ~/.config/containers/storage.conf, which should be updated to a local directory on the host if using NFS.

Q/A.question: What additional configuration steps are needed to run Podman with local Nvidia GPUs?
Q/A.answer: To run Podman with local Nvidia GPUs, staff must ensure the nvidia-container-runtime package is installed on any individual workstation or standalone (non-cluster) server.

Q/A.question: How can a user build their own image starting from an example repository using Podman?
Q/A.answer: A user can build their own image by cloning the example repository, changing the directory to the cloned repository, and then running the command 'podman build -t gpudocker .'.

Q/A.question: What command allows users to run a test script with Podman to verify GPU functionality?
Q/A.answer: The command to run a test script with Podman to verify GPU functionality is '$ podman run --volume `pwd`/test:/mnt --hooks-dir=/usr/share/containers/oci/hooks.d gpudocker python3 /mnt/test_torch.py'.

Q/A.question: What are 'feature updates' designed to do for Windows machines?
Q/A.answer: Feature updates are designed to bring a large set of new features to all machines that can run Windows.

Q/A.question: How frequently does Microsoft typically release feature updates for Windows?
Q/A.answer: Feature updates are typically released annually by Microsoft.

Q/A.question: When did UMIACS deploy the current Windows 10 feature release?
Q/A.answer: The current Windows 10 feature release was deployed on March 15th, 2023.

Q/A.question: What is the end of support date for Windows 10?
Q/A.answer: Windows 10 reaches end of support on October 14th, 2025.

Q/A.question: What OS versions are currently being feature released at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The current feature releases at UMIACS are Windows 10 version 22H2 and Windows 11 version 23H2.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of supplemental updates that follow feature updates?
Q/A.answer: Supplemental updates are security patches that must be installed after the feature update itself.

Q/A.question: How does the Windows Patch Management handle the installation of feature updates?
Q/A.answer: The Windows Patch Management automatically installs feature updates when released to supported systems, and users receive notifications to install them.

Q/A.question: What additional steps may be required after installing a feature update?
Q/A.answer: Additional reboots may be required while installing the supplemental updates thereafter, in addition to the reboot issued as part of the feature update install process.

Q/A.question: How does UMIACS ensure compatibility of feature updates?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS releases feature updates to be installed several months after Microsoft releases them to the general public to ensure compatibility with all software that is run, such as their VPN.

Q/A.question: What documentation would one refer to for a comprehensive list of what is new in the feature updates?
Q/A.answer: For a comprehensive list of what is new in these feature updates, one can see Microsoft's documentation.

Q/A.question: What type of accounts are necessary to view the room schedules?
Q/A.answer: Only UMD accounts can view rooms.

Q/A.question: Which URL must be navigated to in order to view room schedules?
Q/A.answer: https://calendar.google.com

Q/A.question: What information will Google prompt you for when adding a UMD account?

Q/A.question: What is the first step to start changing display settings on MacOS?

Q/A.question: What action must be taken to switch from extended mode to mirror mode?

Q/A.question: When did the CML cluster's compute nodes fold into Nexus?
Q/A.answer: The compute nodes from CML's previous standalone cluster have folded into Nexus as of the scheduled maintenance window for August 2023 (Thursday 08/17/2023, 5-8pm).

Q/A.question: What command do you use to log in to a submission host on Nexus?
Q/A.answer: You can SSH to nexuscml.umiacs.umd.edu to log in to a submission host.

Q/A.question: What is prepended to all of the values that were present in the standalone CML cluster after integration with Nexus?
Q/A.answer: The prefix cml- is prepended to all of the values that were present in the standalone CML cluster.

Q/A.question: What is the maximum submission limit of jobs per user in the cml-dpart partition?
Q/A.answer: The cml-dpart partition has a max submission limit of 500 jobs per user simultaneously.

Q/A.question: Which CML partition allows jobs longer run times and more resources, but is preemptable?
Q/A.answer: The cml-scavenger partition allows jobs longer run times and more resources, but is preemptable.

Q/A.question: What is the total amount of home directory storage available to users?
Q/A.answer: You have 30GB of home directory storage available at /nfshomes/<username>.

Q/A.question: What approvals are required for project-based allocations between 3TB and 6TB?
Q/A.answer: Allocations above 3TB (up to 6TB) require approval from both a CML faculty member and the director of CML.

Q/A.question: What is the storage limit for the network scratch directory?
Q/A.answer: You have 200GB of scratch storage available at /cmlscratch/<username>.

Q/A.question: How often does the tmpwatch job delete unaccessed data from local scratch directories?
Q/A.answer: The tmpwatch job will delete unaccessed data after 90 days, scheduled via maintenance jobs to run once a month during our monthly maintenance windows.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to check the total number of Track-able Resources (TRES) allowed for each account?
Q/A.answer: $ sacctmgr show assoc account=cml format=user,account,qos,grptres

Q/A.question: What is required for an account to be established in UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: All accounts in UMIACS are sponsored by a faculty member.

Q/A.question: What type of reports does UMIACS provide to faculty members?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS provides reports to give faculty members information on the status of the account(s) they have sponsored.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the 'username' field in a UMIACS user report?
Q/A.answer: The 'username' field represents the UMIACS username for the account.

Q/A.question: What information does the 'uidnumber' field contain?
Q/A.answer: The 'uidnumber' field contains a numeric identifier for the UMIACS username.

Q/A.question: What does the 'gidnumber' represent in the user report?
Q/A.answer: The 'gidnumber' is a numeric identifier for the account's UMIACS default group.

Q/A.question: How is the 'name' field in the user report determined?
Q/A.answer: 'name' is the display name if set, or the full name if the display name is not set.

Q/A.question: What does the 'sponsors' field list?
Q/A.answer: The 'sponsors' field lists UMIACS usernames for account sponsors, separated by semicolons.

Q/A.question: What information is found in the 'groups' field?
Q/A.answer: The 'groups' field lists UMIACS unix groups the user is a member of, separated by semicolons.

Q/A.question: What do the 'secgroups' represent in the user report?
Q/A.answer: The 'secgroups' represent UMIACS security groups the user is a member of, separated by semicolons.

Q/A.question: What does the 'crs' field denote?
Q/A.answer: The 'crs' field lists the Computational Resources the user is allowed to access in UMIACS, separated by semicolons.

Q/A.question: How does UMIACS handle user email addresses according to the 'emailtype' field?
Q/A.answer: The 'emailtype' field indicates how UMIACS handles their username@umiacs.umd.edu email.

Q/A.question: What information does the 'installed' field represent?
Q/A.answer: The 'installed' field represents the date and time when the account was first installed in UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What does the 'lastlogon' field indicate?
Q/A.answer: The 'lastlogon' field indicates the date and time when the account was last authenticated with a password.

Q/A.question: Why may the 'lastlogon' date and time not be completely accurate?
Q/A.answer: Due to active directory technical design, it may not be completely accurate in the last 5-14 days.

Q/A.question: What does the 'recoverysms' field signify?
Q/A.answer: The 'recoverysms' field indicates whether the user has a recovery SMS number on file for automated password resets.

Q/A.question: What must be unchecked during the installation of Python via the .exe installer to avoid installation failure?

Q/A.answer: The user must add the python folder to their path.

Q/A.answer: The file msvc9compiler.py must be edited.

Q/A.question: What commands should be used to replace specific lines in the msvc9compiler.py file?
Q/A.answer: The line containing toolskey = 'VS%0.f0COMNTOOLS' % version should be replaced with toolskey = 'vs110COMNTOOLS', and mfinfo = self.manifest_get_embed_info(target_desc, Id_args) should be replaced with mfinfo = None.

Q/A.answer: NumPy can be installed with the installer found at https://pypi.python.org/pypi/numpy/.

Q/A.question: What steps are suggested to add the Python folder to the system path on Windows?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to Control Panel -> System and Security -> System, select Advanced system settings, then in the Advanced tab, click the Environment Variables button, check if a Variable called Path exists, and if so, add the python directory to the end. If it does not exist, create a new variable 'Path' and set the value to the path of the Python directory.

Q/A.question: What system is UMIACS upgrading to based on Jira Software?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS is upgrading to a new system based on Jira Service Desk.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the upgrade to Jira Service Desk?
Q/A.answer: The upgrade will allow UMIACS to standardize on a more stable platform for future important bug and security patches.

Q/A.answer: Yes, email to staff@umiacs.umd.edu will continue to be received by staff as normal.

Q/A.answer: For internal users, the JIRA login will now be their UMIACS username instead of their email address.

Q/A.answer: External requests will no longer have accounts in Jira but can still communicate with Staff via email.

Q/A.answer: All order updates will now be sent/received through orders@umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.answer: New orders should be started by emailing orders@umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: Can UMIACS Staff convert orders sent to staff@umiacs.umd.edu after the migration?
Q/A.answer: Yes, UMIACS Staff is happy to convert orders sent to staff@umiacs.umd.edu as usual.

Q/A.question: What are the two types of mailing lists mentioned in the text?

Q/A.question: What is the primary function of mailaliases?
Q/A.answer: Mailaliases are simple email redirects that allow for <listnamehere>@umiacs.umd.edu to be forwarded to a set list of email addresses.

Q/A.question: In what situation are mailaliases ideal?
Q/A.answer: Mailaliases are ideal for situations where there is a set number of addresses in mind (i.e. no membership changes) and there is no need for moderation on the list.

Q/A.question: What features do Mailman mailing lists have?
