Q/A.question: What system does UMIACS support for faculty members?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS supports a web content management system that allows faculty members to add modify their user profile on the UMIACS website.

Q/A.question: Where can faculty members log into the content management system?
Q/A.answer: Faculty members can log into the content management system at https://www.umiacs.umd.edu/user.

Q/A.question: How can a user begin editing their profile after logging in?
Q/A.answer: A user can begin editing their profile by clicking the 'Edit' tab.

Q/A.question: What should a user do to modify the information displayed for their profile?
Q/A.answer: To modify the information displayed for their profile, a user should click the 'UMIACS staff' link at the top-right of the page.

Q/A.question: What types of information can be edited in a profile?
Q/A.answer: A user may edit their name, Academic Title, Research Focus, Education field, biography, home page location, mailing address, telephone, or fax.

Q/A.question: What should be noted about changes made without clicking 'UMIACS Staff'?
Q/A.answer: Changes made to the default profile, without clicking 'UMIACS Staff', will not be properly displayed on the site.

Q/A.question: Why might changes not be visible immediately after they are made?
Q/A.answer: Changes may not be visible for up to five minutes due to the use of caching to increase performance and reliability.

Q/A.question: How can users add bibliography entries after logging in?
Q/A.answer: Users can add bibliography entries by clicking on 'Biblio/Publication' at the right edge of the screen.

Q/A.question: What options do users have when entering a bibliography item?
Q/A.answer: Users may enter a bibliography item with a Digital Object Identifier (DOI), a Bibtex record, a RIS record, or manually by selecting a 'Publication Type' from the drop down box.

Q/A.question: What should be noted about changes made to bibliography entries?
Q/A.answer: Changes made to bibliography entries may not be visible for up to five minutes due to the use of caching to increase performance and reliability.

Q/A.question: What are Computational Resources described as within UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Computational Resources are physical and virtual machines within UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What are the two categories of compute resources listed in the Current Offerings section?
Q/A.answer: High Performance Computing (HPC) Lab and User-Supported Compute Resources.

Q/A.question: What service is included under the virtualization category?
Q/A.answer: Virtualization.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of snapshots in a file system?
Q/A.answer: Snapshots allow for a file system to quickly take a point-in-time copy of the file system and provide access to the data through a .snapshot directory.

Q/A.question: How do snapshots help in data recovery compared to tape backups?
Q/A.answer: Snapshots provide a fast, user-accessible way to recover data that has been accidentally deleted or corrupted within a recent time window, rather than having to retrieve the data from comparatively slow tape backups.

Q/A.question: On which filers are snapshots provided according to the text?
Q/A.answer: Snapshots are provided on Isilon, ZFS, VAST, and Qumulo filers.

Q/A.question: What is the retention length for hourly snapshots in the core file systems?
Q/A.answer: Hourly snapshots have a retention length of 24-32 hours.

Q/A.question: What is the schedule for daily snapshots based on the provided retention policy?
Q/A.answer: Daily snapshots are taken every day at 8pm or 12am and are retained for 2 days.

Q/A.question: Which directory names are used for accessing snapshots in Isilon, VAST, and Qumulo filers?
Q/A.answer: The directory name used for accessing snapshots in Isilon, VAST, and Qumulo filers is .snapshot.

Q/A.question: What might occur to hourly snapshots when daily snapshots are taken?
Q/A.answer: Hourly snapshots may be superseded by daily snapshots.

Q/A.question: If a user needs to recover a deleted file, how can they access the snapshots directory?
Q/A.answer: The snapshots directory can be accessed by navigating to .snapshot for the Isilon, VAST, or Qumulo filers, or zfs/snapshot for the ZFS filer.

Q/A.question: What command is used to list the contents of the snapshots directory for the Isilon filesystem?
Q/A.answer: The command used is 'ls'.

Q/A.question: What does the structure of the ZFS snapshots' directory include according to the example given?
Q/A.answer: The ZFS snapshots' directory includes entries like zfs-auto-snap_daily and zfs-auto-snap_hourly, each followed by a date and time.

Q/A.question: What must you do if the KFS account you plan on charging is owned by the Computer Science Department?
Q/A.answer: Consult their FAQ for ordering the equipment you want.

Q/A.question: What should ticket descriptions contain when making an order?
Q/A.answer: A list of specific items being ordered, preferably with direct links, unless you're attaching an official quote.

Q/A.question: What are the connectivity requirements to access the web form for placing an order?
Q/A.answer: You need to be connected to either the wired campus network, campus WiFi, the campus VPN, or the UMIACS VPN.

Q/A.question: When sending an email to staff directly for an order, what must be included if the account requires committee approval?
Q/A.answer: You must CC the PI or include the email confirmation for any accounts that require committee approval.

Q/A.question: What is the suggested format for the summary field when logging an order in Jira?
Q/A.answer: The format should be 'Vendor | Brief Description'. If the order must be placed today, it should be 'PRIORITY TODAY | Vendor | Brief Description'.

Q/A.question: What information should be provided in the description field for an order through Jira?
Q/A.answer: A description of what you want to buy, providing a link to the item when possible, and stating the specific vendor that is providing the item when purchasing through sites like Amazon.

Q/A.question: What happens after staff receives the order as long as the PI is CC'd and all needed information is present?
Q/A.answer: The order will be processed, and you will receive an email to pick up the order(s) when it arrives.

Q/A.question: What should you do if someone other than yourself or the PI is sent to pick up the items?
Q/A.answer: You should let the staff know who that person is prior to having them arrive for pickup.

Q/A.question: What should be included in an order if quotes are used to specify items?
Q/A.answer: Quotes must include any applicable shipping costs.

Q/A.question: When ordering from numerous vendors, what is the protocol for sending emails?
Q/A.answer: Send one email per vendor.

Q/A.question: What is the minimum macOS version required to use the Ivanti Connect Secure Client?
Q/A.answer: macOS 13.x or higher

Q/A.question: What must a device be enrolled with for multi-factor authentication in the UMIACS VPN setup?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS Duo

Q/A.question: What happens when the Ivanti Connect Secure Client is started for the first time?
Q/A.answer: It may ask to upgrade the client.

Q/A.question: What should be entered in the 'Server URL' field when creating a new VPN connection?
Q/A.answer: vpn.umiacs.umd.edu

Q/A.question: What action should be taken in the secondary password box if a user wants to push a notification for MFA?
Q/A.answer: Type the word 'push'.

Q/A.question: What must a user do if they wish to register a YubiKey for use with the VPN?
Q/A.answer: Contact UMIACS Tech Staff.

Q/A.question: What does a green arrow in the status icon indicate?
Q/A.answer: You are connected.

Q/A.question: Where can the Pulse Secure application be found if the status icon is not in the status bar?
Q/A.answer: In the Applications folder.

Q/A.question: Which menu must a user navigate through to allow the extension from 'Pulse Secure LLC' if it was blocked?
Q/A.answer: System Settings > Privacy & Security.

Q/A.question: What should a user do after clicking 'Next' to a message about blocked software from 'Pulse Secure LLC'?
Q/A.answer: Click 'Allow' to enable the extension.

Q/A.question: What is the primary function of Rclone?
Q/A.answer: Rclone is a command line program useful for syncing files and directories.

Q/A.question: How does Rclone's functionality compare to rsync?
Q/A.answer: Its functionality is similar to rsync, but has additional capabilities that support cloud storage services.

Q/A.question: What command is needed to load the Rclone module on a UMIACS host?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'module load rclone'.

Q/A.question: What command should be run to find the location of the Rclone configuration file?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'rclone config file'.

Q/A.question: What output can you expect when you run the command 'rclone config file'?
Q/A.answer:
$ rclone config file
Configuration file is stored at:/home/user/.rclone.conf

Q/A.question: Which command do you execute to authorize Rclone on a headless machine?
Q/A.answer: Run the command 'rclone authorize "amazon cloud drive"'.

Q/A.question: What should you do if your browser does not open automatically during the Rclone authorization process?
Q/A.answer: Go to the link: http://127.0.0.1:53682/auth.

Q/A.question: What token do you need to paste into the remote machine when setting up authorization?
Q/A.answer: The token is labeled 'SECRET_TOKEN'.

Q/A.question: What command do you use to create a new remote in Rclone?
Q/A.answer: Run the command 'rclone config'.

Q/A.question: What storage type should you input when creating a remote for Google Drive in Rclone?
Q/A.answer: Input 'drive' for Google Drive.

Q/A.question: Which scope is suggested for full operation when requesting access from Google Drive?
Q/A.answer: The suggested value for full operation is 1.

Q/A.question: What command allows you to list directories in the top level of your Google Drive using Rclone?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'rclone lsd <REMOTENAME>:'.

Q/A.question: How do you create a cronjob for an Rclone command?
Q/A.answer: Use the command 'crontab -e' to edit your crontab and input your Rclone command.

Q/A.question: What is the example of an Rclone cronjob that would occur every hour on the hour?
Q/A.answer: 0 * * * * /opt/common/rclone-v1.53.4-linux-amd64/rclone copy /<PATHTOBEBACKEDUP>/ <REMOTENAME>:<BACKUPNAME>

Q/A.question: When setting up a new Dropbox remote in Rclone, what should you do when prompted for your Dropbox App Key and Secret?
Q/A.answer: It is okay to leave those blank.

Q/A.question: What is the room number where the mailroom is located?
Q/A.answer: Room 5109.

Q/A.question: How are UMIACS staff notified when packages are ready for pickup?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS staff is automatically notified by the mailroom.

Q/A.question: To which location will the mailroom bring items for processing?
Q/A.answer: The UMIACS HelpDesk.

Q/A.question: What will happen after the UMIACS HelpDesk processes the items?
Q/A.answer: They will contact you when items are ready for pickup.

Q/A.question: What is the full address to which items can be ordered?
Q/A.answer: 5109 Brendan Iribe Center for Computer Science and Engineering, 8125 Paint Branch Drive, College Park, MD 20742.

Q/A.question: What does the mailroom do after items are shipped to the specified address?
Q/A.answer: The mailroom will then contact you when items are ready for pickup.

Q/A.question: What type of tools are defined as collaboration tools in the provided text?
Q/A.answer: Collaboration tools are designed to improve the ease of sharing and modifying data with a group of people.

Q/A.question: What is GitLab according to the information provided?
Q/A.answer: GitLab is a web-based git repository manager with wiki and issue tracking features.

Q/A.question: What storage solution is mentioned in the Current Offerings section?
Q/A.answer: Object Storage is the mentioned storage solution.

Q/A.question: What is tmux and what is its primary function?
Q/A.answer: tmux is a terminal multiplexer for Unix-like operating systems that allows multiple terminal sessions to be accessed simultaneously in a single window.

Q/A.question: How can a user create a new tmux session with a specific name?
Q/A.answer: A user can create a new tmux session with a specific name by using the command '# tmux new -s mysession'.

Q/A.question: What command is used to detach a tmux session from the terminal?
Q/A.answer: To detach a tmux session from the terminal, the command used is '# Ctrl-b + d'.

Q/A.question: What will the output of the command '# tmux ls' look like if multiple sessions are running?
Q/A.answer: The output will be similar to this: '# mysession: 1 windows (created Thu Oct 22 10:11:44 2020) # session2: 1 windows (created Thu Oct 22 10:11:52 2020) # session3: 1 windows (created Thu Oct 22 10:11:58 2020)'.

Q/A.question: What is the command to rename the current window in tmux?
Q/A.answer: The command to rename the current window in tmux is '# Ctrl-b ,'.

Q/A.question: What keystroke is used to enter Copy Mode in tmux?
Q/A.answer: To enter Copy Mode in tmux, the keystroke used is '# Ctrl-b ['.

Q/A.question: What commands do you use to navigate to the top and bottom of a page while in Copy Mode?
Q/A.answer: To navigate to the top of the page, type '# g', and to go to the bottom of the page, type '# G'.

Q/A.question: How can a user change the prefix keystroke from Ctrl-b to Ctrl-a?
Q/A.answer: A user can change the prefix keystroke from Ctrl-b to Ctrl-a by adding the following to their ~/.tmux.conf: '# remap prefix from 'C-b' to 'C-a' unbind C-b set-option -g prefix C-a bind-key C-a send-prefix'.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended account type for publishing data at UMIACS to ensure permanence?
Q/A.answer: Any/all data should be published via a faculty member's account or a Labgroup, not a student's.

Q/A.question: What should be done to any papers that contain UMIACS URLs?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS should be credited on any papers that contain UMIACS URLs.

Q/A.question: What are LabGroups at UMIACS used for?
Q/A.answer: LabGroups allow for multiple users to upload data to a central shared location, which is especially useful for projects with multiple contributors.

Q/A.question: What is the preferred method for publishing websites and data at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The preferred method for publishing websites, data, and related info is through the UMIACS Object Storage (OBJ).

Q/A.question: What is a 'bucket' in the context of OBJ?
Q/A.answer: A 'bucket' is essentially a folder that stores files in the UMIACS Object Storage.

Q/A.question: What must you do to make a file publicly available in OBJ?
Q/A.answer: Click the settings cog on the right side of the file, scroll down, and click 'Make Key Public'.

Q/A.question: What two main files does UMIACS recommend including when publishing websites?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS recommends including an index.html file and a 404 error file when publishing websites.

Q/A.question: What must you configure in the bucket settings to publish a website?
Q/A.answer: Under the 'Website Hosting' section, you need to put the name of your index file and the name of your 404 page.

Q/A.question: What is advised to do with sensitive data when using buckets to publish websites?
Q/A.answer: It is recommended to keep any sensitive/access controlled data in a separate bucket.

Q/A.question: What steps should be taken to make a website non-public after it has been published?
Q/A.answer: Click 'Remove Website Configuration' and then 'Make Private'.

Q/A.question: What kernel version is RHEL7 based on?
Q/A.answer: RHEL7 is based on the Linux 3.10.0-957 kernel.

Q/A.question: What is the default file system used in RHEL7?
Q/A.answer: The default file system in RHEL7 is XFS.

Q/A.question: What is the maximum filesystem size supported by XFS in RHEL7?
Q/A.answer: XFS supports filesystem sizes of up to 500 TB in RHEL7.

Q/A.question: What module does RHEL7 include to enhance its security architecture?
Q/A.answer: RHEL7 includes Security-Enhanced Linux (SELinux) as a module to enhance its security architecture.

Q/A.question: What is the maximum standalone filesystem size for ext4 filesystems in RHEL7?
Q/A.answer: The maximum standalone filesystem size for ext4 filesystems in RHEL7 is 50 TB.

Q/A.question: What process management system has replaced the initial process in RHEL7?
Q/A.answer: The initial process in RHEL7 has been changed to systemd.

Q/A.question: What virtualization technology is built into RHEL7 for running virtual machines?
Q/A.answer: RHEL7 includes the built-in Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM) for running virtual machines.

Q/A.question: What file system is categorized as an 'unsupported Technology Preview' in RHEL7?
Q/A.answer: Btrfs is categorized as an 'unsupported Technology Preview' in RHEL7.

Q/A.question: What mechanism does XFS use to minimize data loss during a system crash?
Q/A.answer: XFS supports journaling to minimize data loss in the event of a system crash.

Q/A.question: What is the role of SELinux in RHEL7?
Q/A.answer: SELinux implements a mandatory access control model in RHEL7.

Q/A.question: What are the two main flavors of Java supported according to the document?
Q/A.answer: Oracle Java and OpenJDK.

Q/A.question: What is usually sufficient for running programs and applets written in Java if one does not do programming in Java?
Q/A.answer: Java Runtime Environment (JRE).

Q/A.question: What command can be run on any RHEL/Ubuntu machine to check the version of Java?
Q/A.answer: bash-4.2$ java -version.

Q/A.question: Where can alternative JDK and JRE options be found on the machine?
Q/A.answer: /usr/lib/jvm.

Q/A.question: Is JRE included in JDK, and is there a need to install both?
Q/A.answer: Yes, JRE is included in JDK, so there is no need to install both.

Q/A.question: What happens to JRE on all supported workstations?
Q/A.answer: It is installed by default and auto-updated to the latest version periodically.

Q/A.question: What should you do if your machine does not have Java installed?
Q/A.answer: Send a request to staff to have JRE or JDK installed on your machine.

Q/A.question: What are the base hardware requirements for university-owned laptops to qualify for UMIACS support?
Q/A.answer: Business or professional model line from a tier one manufacturer (e.g. Dell, HP, Microsoft), 3+ years OEM warranty/support (i.e. no refurbished equipment or third-party vendor warranties), readily available manufacturer diagnostic tools, and readily available hardware drivers.

Q/A.question: Under which conditions can UMIACS hardware support be given to dual-boot laptops?
Q/A.answer: Dual-boot laptops are only eligible for UMIACS Hardware Support. If you later set up or attempt to set up dual-boot on a system that UMIACS staff previously configured with either Enterprise or Base level support, UMIACS cannot offer help if you run into issues with the dual-booting process or either operating system thereafter.

Q/A.question: What kind of support does UMIACS Enterprise Laptop Support offer?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS Enterprise laptop support provides a secure computing platform with automated backups and security updates, installation of an Enterprise version of Microsoft Windows, F-Secure Client Security, Ivanti Security Scan, Microsoft Office, and MATLAB, along with encryption of the hard drive using BitLocker.

Q/A.question: What is the primary responsibility of the user under UMIACS Base Laptop Support?
Q/A.answer: The user is responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the Operating System and any data stored on the laptop.

Q/A.question: What services are provided under UMIACS Hardware Support?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS Hardware support provides basic hardware diagnostics and warranty repairs, while allowing you to have full control over the software and data stored on your laptop.

Q/A.question: What happens to the device data when it is returned to UMIACS under both Enterprise and Base support?
Q/A.answer: Data archival upon return of the device to UMIACS is provided.

Q/A.question: If a user does not have access to Terpware for downloadable software, what should they do?
Q/A.answer: They should contact the HelpDesk.

Q/A.question: Which software suites are installed under UMIACS Base Laptop Support?
Q/A.answer: The software suites include F-Secure Client Security, Microsoft Office, and MATLAB.

Q/A.question: What is the occupancy of the conference room IRB-1127?
Which conference rooms have an AutoAccept type classification?
How many total rooms listed are categorized as Moderated?
What is the occupancy of the largest Moderated conference room mentioned?
Which conference room has the smallest occupancy capacity?
Q/A.answer: 6, with rooms IRB-1119, IRB-2119, IRB-2143, IRB-4119, IRB-5111, IRB-5119, and IRB-5161 all having this occupancy.

Q/A.question: What is the occupancy of IRB-3137?
List all conference rooms with an occupancy of 20.
What is the total number of conference rooms listed?
What should a user do if they experience an authentication failure after changing their password in the Ivanti Secure Access client?
Q/A.answer: The user should open the Ivanti Secure Access client, right-click on the desired connection, and click on Forget Saved Settings. Afterwards, they need to re-enter their new credentials and reconnect.

Q/A.question: What steps should a macOS user follow to fix an authentication failure in the Ivanti Secure Access client?
Q/A.answer: The macOS user should open the Ivanti Secure Access client, click on the 3 lines on the top left corner (if using the New-UX client), select Forget Settings, and then re-enter their new credentials and reconnect.

Q/A.question: What is the suggested action if a user encounters an upgrade failure with the VPN client?
Q/A.answer: The user should delete and reinstall the VPN client if the upgrade process is stuck.

Q/A.question: What should users do if they receive the error code 1300 when connecting from the Ivanti Secure Access client?
Q/A.answer: Users should Forget Saved Settings and retry, or remove and re-add the VPN connection on the client.

Q/A.question: Who should users contact if they continue to experience issues following a VPN client auto upgrade?
Q/A.answer: Users should contact staff@umiacs.umd.edu if they continue to have issues.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of the backups conducted by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The primary purpose of the backups conducted by UMIACS is to provide accidental deletion coverage.

Q/A.question: How many days of coverage does UMIACS aim to provide through its nightly backups?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS aims to provide 90 days of coverage through its nightly backups.

Q/A.question: What is the frequency of the backups conducted by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The frequency of the backups conducted by UMIACS is one backup per night.

Q/A.question: Why might the backup coverage not be perfect?
Q/A.answer: The backup coverage may not be perfect because the backups are very coarse, and depending on the size of the change and size of the file, backups may be periodically missed.

Q/A.question: What challenges are mentioned regarding files that change often in relation to nightly backups?
Q/A.answer: Files that change often may not have all versions backed up to 90 days.

Q/A.question: What is indicated about files that are created very recently in relation to nightly backups?
Q/A.answer: Files that were created very recently may not be backed up.

Q/A.question: What action should a person take if they need something from the nightly backups?
Q/A.answer: A person should contact staff with the full path to the directory(s) which they would like to have restored.

Q/A.question: In which location does UMIACS maintain conference rooms?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS maintains conference rooms in the Brendan Iribe Center and a few in the Atlantic building.

Q/A.question: What are the names of the two different conference room locations mentioned?
Q/A.answer: The two different conference room locations mentioned are the Brendan Iribe Center and the Atlantic building.

Q/A.question: What happens when you touch the panel to start it up after the room was in a 'shut down' state?
Q/A.answer: It will turn on the display(s) for the room and lower the projector screens if any are present.

Q/A.question: What are the three common source options available on the touch panels?
Q/A.answer: "Solstice", "Laptop Device" (just "Laptop" on some panels), and "Room PC" (the third option only in non-huddle rooms).

Q/A.question: In moderated rooms, where can you find the volume control for the sources?
Q/A.answer: The volume control is on the Device Control menu.

Q/A.question: What special option is available at the top of the source/destination menu in moderated rooms?
Q/A.answer: "Device Control" option.

Q/A.question: What should you do when you are done using the room PC?
Q/A.answer: Log off to ensure the account is fully wiped, so the next group does not have access to anything you may have signed into.

Q/A.question: How do you connect a device to display it in the room using the Laptop Device option?
Q/A.answer: Connect your device to either the HDMI cable or VGA/aux cables coming out of the middle of the desk in the room.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the 'Shutdown A/V System' button?
Q/A.answer: To save energy and give the next group using the room a clean slate by turning off the display(s) and raising the projector screens if any are present.

Q/A.question: Which rooms have the capability to display an external device's screen wirelessly using Solstice?
Q/A.answer: Auto-Accept Rooms and Huddle Rooms.

Q/A.question: What specific controls can be managed through the Device Control option in moderated rooms?
Q/A.answer: Volume, and in some rooms, lighting, microphones, and settings for other integrated devices such as the room's Blu-ray player, TV tuner, or room cameras.

Q/A.question: What instructions will you see when you select the Solstice option on the touch panel?
Q/A.answer: Instructions on how to display your device(s) to the room's display wirelessly.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended choice of development environment for Java according to the text?
Q/A.answer: The recommended choice of development environment for Java is the Sun ONE Development Studio.

Q/A.question: What was the former name of the Sun ONE Development Studio?
Q/A.answer: The former name of the Sun ONE Development Studio is Forte for Java.

Q/A.question: Who created the Java programming language?
Q/A.answer: Java was created by Sun.

Q/A.question: Is the Sun ONE Development Studio available for free?
Q/A.answer: Yes, the Sun ONE Development Studio is freely available.

Q/A.question: On which operating systems can the Sun ONE Development Studio run?
Q/A.answer: The Sun ONE Development Studio can run on any OS and platform for which JDK is available, including Unix, Linux, Windows, and Mac.

Q/A.question: What type of software is the Sun ONE Development Studio written in?
Q/A.answer: The Sun ONE Development Studio is written entirely in Java.

Q/A.question: What is the feedback status regarding Borland's JBuilder as mentioned in the text?
Q/A.answer: The text states that there has been negative feedback on Borland's JBuilder from users in the past.

Q/A.question: Why is Microsoft's Visual J++ not recommended?
Q/A.answer: Microsoft's Visual J++ is not recommended because it is not compatible with the new language specifications.

Q/A.question: Which versions of Microsoft's Visual J++ are mentioned in the text as being problematic?
Q/A.answer: Version 6 and the .NET version of Microsoft's Visual J++ are mentioned.

Q/A.question: What are the prerequisites for using the VPN Client mentioned in the text?
Q/A.answer: A full UMIACS account, device enrolled with UMIACS Duo for multi-factor authentication, and an established network connection (mobile data or wireless).

Q/A.question: Which platforms can the Pulse Secure Client be downloaded from?
Q/A.answer: The app can be downloaded for free from the App Store for iOS and Google Play for Android.

Q/A.question: What is the initial step when launching the Pulse Secure Client?
Q/A.answer: When the client is first launched, it will prompt you to accept its license agreement.

Q/A.question: What URL should be entered when prompted for a Corporate E-mail address or URL in the client configuration?
Q/A.answer: vpn.umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What basic information is required when adding a connection in the Pulse Secure Client?
Q/A.answer: Connection Name: UMIACS VPN and Username: <your UMIACS username>.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the 'Connect' button in the Pulse Secure Client?
Q/A.answer: The 'Connect' button is used to start the VPN Connection after the client has been configured.

Q/A.question: How can a user verify their connection status after connecting to the VPN?
Q/A.answer: The connection status is verified by the VPN symbol in the top status bar.

Q/A.question: What must a user do to stop the VPN tunnel once connected?
Q/A.answer: To stop the VPN tunnel, the user must click 'Disconnect'.

Q/A.question: What email services did UMIACS wind down as of June 30th, 2020?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS wound down its Exchange and IMAP mailbox email services.

Q/A.question: What email subject line was sent to users covered by the migration on May 1st, 2020?
Q/A.answer: The email subject line sent was 'UMIACS Email Migration'.

Q/A.question: If a user did not receive the email sent on May 1st, 2020, what action were they directed to take?
Q/A.answer: They were directed to update their email preference in the Directory app before June 2nd, 2020 at 9am.

Q/A.question: What would happen to a user's email forwarding if they did not update their preferences by June 2nd, 2020 at 9am?
Q/A.answer: The UMIACS Technical Staff would update their email forward to be their corresponding @umd.edu email address or the last known email address on record.

Q/A.question: How can users update their email forwarding address if they do not have a @umd.edu address?
Q/A.answer: Users can log into the Directory app, change the listed address under 'Email', and click Submit at the bottom of the page.

Q/A.question: What steps must a user follow to import email from their previous provider into their UMD mailbox?
Q/A.answer: Users must follow the steps detailed for importing email, since UMIACS staff have no administrative access to UMD mailboxes.

Q/A.question: What format will the archive of the UMIACS mailbox be provided in for Exchange users?
Q/A.answer: The archive will be a single file in PST file format.

Q/A.question: What is necessary to import email from PST files into a UMD mailbox?
Q/A.answer: Users must download and install G Suite Migration for Microsoft Outlook and follow DivIT's instructions.

Q/A.question: How will the archive for IMAP users be provided?
Q/A.answer: The archive will consist of several files in MBOX format, compressed into a tarball.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the ImportExportTools NG add-on for Mozilla Thunderbird?
Q/A.answer: The ImportExportTools NG add-on is used to import email from MBOX files into Mozilla Thunderbird.

Q/A.question: What should users do if they have issues during the email import process?
Q/A.answer: Users should contact the Division of IT for assistance.

Q/A.question: Where can users find instructions for forwarding email from their previous provider?
Q/A.answer: Users should search for instructions from their previous provider.

Q/A.question: Can users import email in file formats other than PST or MBOX according to the text?
Q/A.answer: No, the text specifies that users need to export email in either PST or MBOX format to follow the corresponding import steps.

Q/A.question: What protocol is used to connect to Windows hosts remotely at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).

Q/A.question: What must users ensure before attempting to use RDP to connect to a Windows host?
Q/A.answer: Users must be on the UMIACS physical network or VPN and be authorized to access and remotely control the host.

Q/A.question: If a remote session is active, what will happen if another user attempts to log onto the console in-person?
Q/A.answer: It is not possible for another user to log onto the console in-person.

Q/A.question: What format must the username be in when entering UMIACS credentials for RDP access?
Q/A.answer: The username must be in the format UMIACS\username, where username is replaced by the UMIACS username.

Q/A.question: What feature does Audio Redirection provide in the context of Remote Desktop?
Q/A.answer: Audio Redirection allows the remote desktop to access the audio capture and playback devices on the user's desktop.

Q/A.question: What steps should be followed to redirect folders on a Mac when connecting to a remote desktop?
Q/A.answer: Right click over the PC connection, select 'Edit', go to the 'Folders' tab, check 'Redirect folders', and add the desired folders.

Q/A.question: Which application is recommended for connecting to Windows clients over RDP on macOS?
Q/A.answer: Microsoft Remote Desktop application.

Q/A.question: What command should be used to access a Windows host via RDP on an Ubuntu machine using rdesktop?
Q/A.answer: rdesktop -r clipboard:CLIPBOARD -g <GEOMETRY> -d UMIACS -u <USERNAME> <HOSTNAME>.

Q/A.question: What does the xfreerdp command require in order for a user to connect to a remote host?
Q/A.answer: xfreerdp -d UMIACS -u <USERNAME> --plugin cliprdr -g <GEOMETRY> <HOSTNAME>.

Q/A.question: What is indicated if a warning message appears about an identity verification failure when connecting to UMIACS machines?
Q/A.answer: For UMIACS machines, you can ignore this warning and proceed by checking the box and selecting 'Yes'.

Q/A.question: What type of webspace is offered for individual users?
Q/A.answer: Individual user webspace.

Q/A.question: Who should be contacted for more details regarding lab-specific webspace?
Q/A.answer: Staff.

Q/A.question: What is mentioned as upcoming for MediaWiki?
Q/A.answer: Documentation coming soon.

Q/A.question: What command is used to submit a postscript file named 'filename.ps' to a printer queue named 'printername'?
Q/A.answer: lpr -Pprintername filename.ps

Q/A.question: What happens if no printer name is specified when using the 'lpr' command?
Q/A.answer: The job is discarded by the print server.

Q/A.question: Which command is used to remove jobs from a specific printer queue?
Q/A.answer: lprm -Pprintername

Q/A.question: How can you check the status of a printer queue named 'printername'?
Q/A.answer: By using the command 'lpq -Pprintername'.

Q/A.question: What additional information does the '-l' argument provide when using the 'lpq' command?
Q/A.answer: It specifies the id, queue rank, the total size of the job in bytes, and any errors encountered in processing the job.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the 'textps' command?
Q/A.answer: It is used to generate postscript from an existing text file.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to view the contents of a postscript file before printing?
Q/A.answer: ghostview file.ps

Q/A.question: What command can be used to check all print queues available?
Q/A.answer: lpq -a

Q/A.question: If you want to remove a specific job with job id 198 from the queue, what command would you use?
Which command allows you to monitor the job sent to the printer?
Q/A.answer: lpq -Pps432-3208

Q/A.question: What is required for installing CMake as of version 3.4, even when selecting one's home directory?
Q/A.answer: Administrative privilege is required to install CMake.

Q/A.question: What should a non-admin user do if they want to install CMake on a UMIACS-supported system?
Q/A.answer: They should send mail to staff to schedule a time where staff can provide admin credentials.

Q/A.question: Where can the appropriate binary for CMake be retrieved from?
Q/A.answer: The appropriate binary can be retrieved from https://www.cmake.org/download.

Q/A.question: What option does the installer provide regarding the PATH variable?
Q/A.answer: The installer provides the option to automatically modify the PATH variable.

Q/A.question: What are the two options available for using CMake after installation?
Q/A.answer: The two options are to use CMake from the command line if it has been added to your path, or to use the CMake GUI located in the bin directory within the install directory.

Q/A.question: What steps should be followed to configure the compiler using the CMake GUI?
Q/A.answer: Click configure and choose the compiler which has been installed on the system, such as some version of Visual Studio.

Q/A.question: How can the right compiler be passed in when using CMake from the command line?
Q/A.answer: The right compiler can be passed in using the -G option.

Q/A.question: What will typing 'cmake' without any options display?
Q/A.answer: It will display basic help.

Q/A.question: What software has UMIACS staff deployed to manage third-party security vulnerabilities on Windows machines?
Q/A.answer: Ivanti Endpoint Manager.

Q/A.question: On what day of the month are patches always released according to the defined schedule?
Q/A.answer: On the Wednesday that falls between the 9th and the 15th of every month.

Q/A.question: What happens if a user remains active on their system during the nightly update scan time?
Q/A.answer: They will see a popup with the scan beginning and a prompt from Ivanti asking to begin installing patches once the patches are downloaded.

Q/A.question: How often do laptops scan for updates provided they are powered on?
Q/A.answer: At least once every day.

Q/A.question: What is the automatic installation time for patches on desktops if a user does not respond to the prompt?
Q/A.answer: 24 hours.

Q/A.question: What is the maximum time a user can defer a reboot after installation finishes on a desktop?
Q/A.answer: 6 days.

Q/A.question: If a user interrupts the installation process, what may Ivanti request the next time the user installs patches?
Q/A.answer: Ivanti may ask to reboot before continuing to install the remaining patches.

Q/A.question: What is the consequence of trying to manually scan for patches while Ivanti is running an invisible scan?
Q/A.answer: The scan may fail on the 'Checking for other running scanners' step.

Q/A.question: After installing all patches, what options does a user have if they do not want to reboot immediately?
Q/A.answer: They can click on the 'Remind me in:' drop down menu, choose 'More options...', then select 'Remind me on' and choose a date and time before the deadline.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if a patch is continually failing after a reboot?
Q/A.answer: Contact staff.

Q/A.question: What command is used to check the current working directory before removing the Python file?
Q/A.answer: pwd

Q/A.question: What is the file size of virtualenv.py as shown after running ls -lah?
What command is used to remove the virtualenv.py file?
Q/A.answer: rm virtualenv.py

Q/A.question: After removing virtualenv.py, what command is run to verify its removal?
Q/A.answer: ls

Q/A.question: What is the name of the most recent weekly snapshot the user changes directory into?
Q/A.answer: Weekly_nfshomes_2024-06-23_00:00

Q/A.question: In which directory is the Weekly_nfshomes_2024-06-23_00:00 snapshot located?
Q/A.answer: /nfshomes/username/.snapshot

Q/A.question: What command is used to copy the virtualenv.py file back to the original directory?
Q/A.answer: cp virtualenv.py /nfshomes/username/virtualenv/

Q/A.question: What command is executed to confirm that the virtualenv.py file has been successfully restored?
Q/A.answer: ls

Q/A.question: What is an object store, and what are its primary focuses?
Q/A.answer: An object store is a web-based storage solution focused on reliability, scalability, and security.

Q/A.question: What are buckets and keys in the context of S3-like storage?
Q/A.answer: Keys are analogous to files, and a bucket is simply a container for a set of keys.

Q/A.question: How does the UMIACS Object Store ensure data protection from machine failure?
Q/A.answer: Data is protected from individual machine failure via replication within the cluster.

Q/A.question: What storage is allocated to UMIACS users and faculty?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS users are allocated 50GB of storage, while faculty are allocated 10TB.

Q/A.question: What happens if a user deletes a key or bucket in the Object Store?
Q/A.answer: If a user deletes a key or bucket in the Object Store, there is no way to restore that information.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of Access Control Lists (ACLs) in the UMIACS Object Store?
Q/A.answer: ACLs allow users to specify who has what types of access to their buckets at both the bucket level and the individual key level.

Q/A.question: How can users access the UMIACS Object Store from their desktops?
Q/A.answer: Users can access the UMIACS Object Store using the command line UMobj utilities, third-party graphical clients, or programmatically using popular programming languages.

Q/A.question: What role do LabGroup managers play in managing access to buckets?
Q/A.answer: LabGroup managers can grant granular access (read, write, full control, manager) to buckets owned by the LabGroup.

Q/A.question: What should users do to maintain the confidentiality of their Secret Key?
Q/A.answer: Users should treat their Secret Key(s) the same as a password and not plaintext it over email or share it with others.

Q/A.question: What are the implications of bucket names in the UMIACS Object Store?
Q/A.answer: Bucket names must be unique, and a notification will be issued if the name is already taken when creating a bucket.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to take when the electric adjustable standing desk is stuck?
Q/A.answer: Disconnect the table from outlet / power source.

Q/A.question: Which cable should be disconnected from the power box during the troubleshooting process?
Q/A.answer: Disconnect the controller cable (blue end) from the power box.

Q/A.question: Where are the M1 and M2 connectors located?
Q/A.answer: The M1 and M2 connectors are located underneath the desktop or to the desk frame.

Q/A.question: What is the correct procedure for connecting the table leg cables to the M1 and M2 connectors?
Q/A.answer: Connect the cable from the table leg on the same side as the up / down controls to the M1 connector first, then connect the cable from the second leg to the M2 connector.

Q/A.question: What should be done after reconnecting the controller cable and powering the desk on?
Q/A.answer: Press and hold the down button for 5 seconds.

Q/A.question: What should be felt after holding the down button for 5 seconds?
Q/A.answer: A very slight movement.

Q/A.question: What should be done if the desk moves in the opposite direction of the button pressed?
Q/A.answer: Repeat the steps listed above but switch which legs go to the M1 and M2 connectors.

Q/A.question: When switching legs to M1 and M2 connectors, which leg should be connected to the M1 connector first?
Q/A.answer: The leg on the OPPOSITE side of the up/down controls.

Q/A.question: What is important to ensure when connecting cables to the M1 and M2 connectors?
Q/A.answer: You must connect a cable to the M1 connector BEFORE connecting anything to the M2 connector.

Q/A.question: What has happened to the Euclid cluster?
Q/A.answer: The Euclid cluster has been deprecated.

Q/A.question: Who should be contacted if there are questions regarding the Euclid cluster?
Q/A.answer: Staff should be contacted with any questions.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of Computational Resources (CRs) as described in the text?
Q/A.answer: The primary purpose of Computational Resources (CRs) is to provide access control to login shells and GUIs for a set of computers.

Q/A.question: Can users customize their Shell using Computational Resources?
Q/A.answer: Yes, a user can customize their Shell.

Q/A.question: What can staff provide to users depending on the resource?
Q/A.answer: Staff can provide users different home directories depending on the resource.

Q/A.question: What is the Tron partition a subset of?
Q/A.answer: The Tron partition is a subset of resources available in the Nexus.

Q/A.question: How was the Tron partition funded?
Q/A.answer: It was purchased using college-level funding for UMIACS and CSD faculty.

Q/A.question: What is the total quantity of nodes in the full configuration of Tron?
Q/A.answer: The total quantity of nodes in the full configuration of Tron is 70.

Q/A.question: What type of GPU node has 6 units and 256 GB of memory per node?
Q/A.answer: The A6000 GPU Node has 6 units and 256 GB of memory per node.

Q/A.question: How many CPU cores are present per A4000 GPU Node?
Q/A.answer: There are 16 CPU cores per A4000 GPU Node.

Q/A.question: What is the total amount of memory across all nodes listed for Tron?
Q/A.answer: The total amount of memory across all nodes listed for Tron is 1,840 GB.

Q/A.question: How many GPUs are there per RTX 2080 Ti GPU Node?
Q/A.answer: There are 4 GPUs per RTX 2080 Ti GPU Node.

Q/A.question: What is the total number of GPUs in the full configuration of Tron?
Q/A.answer: The total number of GPUs in the full configuration of Tron is 396.

Q/A.question: Which GPU Node type has the least amount of memory per node?
Q/A.answer: The A4000 GPU Node has the least amount of memory per node, with 128 GB.

Q/A.question: What is the specification of the total for all nodes grouped together?
Q/A.answer: The total for all nodes grouped together consists of 69 nodes, 1,840 CPU cores, and 396 GPUs.

Q/A.question: What email address format should you use to log in to the spam quarantine system?
Q/A.answer: username@umiacs.umd.edu

Q/A.question: What are the two URLs provided for accessing the spam quarantine system?
Q/A.answer: bubs.umiacs.umd.edu and pompom.umiacs.umd.edu

Q/A.question: What are the three different filters available for searching emails in the quarantine?
Q/A.answer: 'from', 'subject', and 'message'

Q/A.question: What does the 'from' filter allow you to search for?
Q/A.answer: It allows you to search the emails based on who sent them.

Q/A.question: If you select the 'subject' filter and choose 'contains' while searching for 'binary', what will you see?
Q/A.answer: You will see emails with 'binary' in the subject.

Q/A.question: What outcome results from selecting the 'message' filter?
Q/A.answer: It allows you to search in the body of the email.

Q/A.question: What does selecting 'doesn't contain' under the subject filter signify?
Q/A.answer: It indicates that all emails that don't have 'binary' in the subject will be shown.

Q/A.question: How do you start to change the display settings in RHEL?
Q/A.answer: Open Settings by clicking on Applications -> System Tools -> Settings.

Q/A.question: After opening Settings, which section should be clicked to adjust display settings?
Q/A.answer: Click Devices.

Q/A.question: What is the default display mode used in RHEL?
Q/A.answer: The default display mode is extended mode, called Join Displays in RHEL.

Q/A.question: What option should be selected to switch to mirror mode in RHEL?
Q/A.answer: Select the Mirror option.

Q/A.question: What will happen if the Single Display option is selected?
Q/A.answer: Selecting the Single Display option will only show the display selected below.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to retrieve the latest version of R for Windows according to the installation instructions?
Q/A.answer: Select 'Download R for Windows' from the top of the screen.

Q/A.question: What should you do after clicking 'Install R for the first time' on the download page?
Q/A.answer: Click 'Download R<version number> for Windows' to begin the installation.

Q/A.question: What warning message is displayed when starting the installer for R?
Q/A.answer: There will be a warning that says the full installation requires administrative privileges.

Q/A.question: What is the default folder name suggested for the start menu during the customized options setup?
Q/A.answer: The default 'R' is acceptable for this.

Q/A.question: What options are provided for the interface selection during the customized startup environment setup?
Q/A.answer: MDI (one main window for all R programs) or SDI (separate windows for each R program).

Q/A.question: What formats can the help display be chosen from during the customized startup environment setup?
Q/A.answer: Plain text format or HTML formatted.

Q/A.question: How can users open an R script with RScript?
Q/A.answer: Users can run Rscript path\to\file\test.R from within the \bin\x64 folder at the location that you installed R to.

Q/A.question: What action should be taken if a user is unsure about customizing the options for the startup environment?
Q/A.answer: Select 'No' (can still be changed later).

Q/A.question: What types of laptops are mentioned for backups in the text?
Q/A.answer: Windows or macOS laptops

Q/A.question: What is the frequency of the backups mentioned for laptops?
Q/A.answer: Nightly backups

Q/A.question: Through which system are the nightly backups executed?
Q/A.answer: TSM

Q/A.question: What network must you be connected to in order to print from a personal Ubuntu laptop or desktop at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: You must be on the UMIACS internal network, either via a wired proxy drop or an SSH tunnel.

Q/A.question: What initial action must be taken within the system settings to begin the printer connection process?
Q/A.answer: You must open your system settings and search for the 'Printers' dialog box.

Q/A.question: After opening the 'Printers' dialog box, what options must you select to start adding a new printer?
Q/A.answer: Click 'Additional Settings' and 'Add' in the new box that pops up.

Q/A.question: What URL must you navigate to in order to find the name of the printer you wish to connect to?
Q/A.answer: You need to navigate to http://print.umiacs.umd.edu/printers.

Q/A.question: How should you format the 'Device URI' for adding a printer?
Q/A.answer: Enter ipp://print.umiacs.umd.edu:631/printers/ followed by the name of the printer.

Q/A.question: What is an example of a 'Device URI' for connecting to a printer named 'cps432-3208'?
Q/A.answer: The Device URI would be ipp://print.umiacs.umd.edu:631/printers/cps432-3208.

Q/A.question: What should you do after entering the 'Device URI' and clicking 'Forward'?
Q/A.answer: You will see a list of printer models, from which you should select the brand of the printer.

Q/A.question: What needs to be done after selecting the brand of the printer?
Q/A.answer: Select the specific model of the printer and then click 'Forward'.

Q/A.question: What additional options can you select during the printer setup process?
Q/A.answer: You can select any additional features available for the printer, such as duplexing or trays.

Q/A.question: What should you do to verify that the printer has been properly configured?
Q/A.answer: Print a test page to verify the configuration.

Q/A.question: What result indicates that the printer is not properly configured?
Q/A.answer: If you just get a page with a string of text instead of the default Ubuntu test page.

Q/A.question: What type of reports can be found under the section labeled 'Maintenance reports'?
Q/A.answer: Broken redirects, dead-end pages, double redirects, long pages, oldest pages, orphaned pages, pages with the fewest revisions, pages without language links, protected pages, protected titles, short pages, uncategorized categories, uncategorized files, uncategorized pages, uncategorized templates, unused categories, unused files, unused templates, wanted categories, wanted files, wanted pages, and wanted templates.

Q/A.question: Which sections contain lists of pages?
Q/A.answer: The 'Lists of pages' section contains 'All pages', 'All pages with prefix', 'Categories', 'External links search', 'List of redirects', 'Pages with a page property', and 'Tracking categories'.

Q/A.question: What can be found under the 'Users and rights' section?
Q/A.answer: Active users list, autoblocks, blocked users, bot passwords, grants, link accounts, password policies, preferences, reset tokens, unlink accounts, user contributions, user group rights, user list, and user rights.

Q/A.question: What types of changes are logged under the 'Recent changes and logs' section?
Q/A.answer: Gallery of new files, logs, new pages, recent changes, related changes, and valid change tags.

Q/A.question: Which functionalities are included in the 'Media reports and uploads' section?
Q/A.answer: File list, list of files with duplicates, MIME search, and media statistics.

Q/A.question: What special pages are involved in redirecting actions?
Q/A.answer: Delete a page, differences, edit a page, new section, page history, page info, permanent link, protect a page, purge, random page, random page in category, random redirect, and redirect by file, user, page, revision, or log ID.

Q/A.question: What are considered 'High use pages' according to the text?
Q/A.answer: Most linked-to categories, most linked-to files, most linked-to pages, most transcluded pages, pages with the most categories, pages with the most interwikis, and pages with the most revisions.

Q/A.question: What tools can be found in the 'Page tools' section?
Q/A.answer: Compare pages, export pages, get data, and what links here.

Q/A.question: What type of Ubuntu releases does UMIACS support?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS provides support for Ubuntu LTS (long-term support) releases.

Q/A.question: What is the duration of support for previous Ubuntu LTS releases on the desktop and server?
Q/A.answer: Previous Ubuntu LTS releases are supported for 3 years on the desktop and 5 years on the server.

Q/A.question: Starting with which version of Ubuntu LTS are both desktop and server releases supported for 5 years?
Q/A.answer: Starting with Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, LTS releases will be supported for 5 years on both the desktop and the server.

Q/A.question: What was the end of life date for Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (Xenial)?
Q/A.answer: The end of life date for Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (Xenial) was April 2021.

Q/A.question: What abilities do users have regarding software installation in Ubuntu according to UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Users have the ability to install software from blessed repositories without staff intervention.

Q/A.question: How does the desktop software experience of Ubuntu compare to RHEL offerings?
Q/A.answer: Ubuntu provides a more bleeding edge desktop software experience than the RHEL offerings.

Q/A.question: Where can the software that is commonly provided with Ubuntu LTS releases be found?
Q/A.answer: The software is found in /opt/common.

Q/A.question: What types of software are included in the binary software common tree for Ubuntu LTS releases?
Q/A.answer: The software includes Matlab, Mathematica, Compilers, etc.

Q/A.question: What functionality was introduced starting with Ubuntu 14.04 LTS regarding software paths and libraries?
Q/A.answer: Starting with Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, you can use Modules to easily load these paths and relevant libraries into your environment.

Q/A.question: What step should be taken in the file browser window to access the preferences?
Q/A.answer: In the top bar click 'File -> Preferences'.

Q/A.question: Which tab must be navigated to in order to adjust the thumbnail settings?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to the 'Search & Preview' tab.

Q/A.question: What option must be selected under the thumbnails section to disable thumbnail generation?
Q/A.answer: Under the thumbnails section select 'Never'.

Q/A.question: Where are the thumbnails stored on the system?
Q/A.answer: Thumbnails are stored in the directory ~/.cache/thumbnails/.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to check the current disk space utilization of the thumbnails?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'du -sh ~/.cache/thumbnails/'.

Q/A.question: What is the result of removing the directory ~/.cache/thumbnails/?
Q/A.answer: Removing that directory will clean up the thumbnails.

Q/A.question: What is the format of the email address provided to a UMIACS account?
Q/A.answer: A UMIACS account includes a username@umiacs.umd.edu e-mail address.

Q/A.question: What is required for University of Maryland employees concerning their UMIACS email address?
Q/A.answer: If you are a University of Maryland employee, this address is required to forward to your directoryid@umd.edu e-mail address.

Q/A.question: What options do non-University of Maryland employees have regarding their UMIACS email address forwarding?
Q/A.answer: If you are not a University of Maryland employee, you can forward this address to an external email provider.

Q/A.question: For how long can email forwarding be provided if a UMIACS account was closed?
Q/A.answer: If your UMIACS account was closed within the last year, we can provide forwarding for this address up until one year from the date that the account was closed upon request only.

Q/A.question: What should a user do to set up forwarding for a closed UMIACS account?
Q/A.answer: Please contact staff and let us know the address to forward to.

Q/A.question: What can users with a previous UMIACS Exchange or IMAP mailbox request after the email migration in June 2020?
Q/A.answer: If you would like a copy of the archive of your mailbox we made, please contact staff.

Q/A.question: How can users verify their current email preference?
Q/A.answer: You can verify your current E-mail preference through the Directory Profile Tool.

Q/A.question: What has UMIACS deployed into their mail infrastructure to enhance email security?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS has deployed spam firewalls into our mail infrastructure to provide additional virus and spam filtering capabilities.

Q/A.question: Where can users find more information about interacting with their spam quarantine?
Q/A.answer: Please see the Spam firewall page.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of the Intel VTune Amplifier XE Suite?
Q/A.answer: The Intel VTune Amplifier XE Suite is a profiler and performance analyzer for Intel chips.

Q/A.question: What type of license does UMIACS have for the Intel VTune Amplifier XE Suite?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS has a single floating license that can be checked out for RHEL.

Q/A.question: Which command is used to load the VTune Modules in the shell?
Q/A.answer: The command to load the VTune Modules in the shell is 'module load vtune'.

Q/A.question: What are the two interfaces available for using the Intel VTune Amplifier XE Suite?
Q/A.answer: The two interfaces available are amplxe-cl for the command line and amplxe-gui for the graphical user interface.

Q/A.question: What is the primary function of SLURM as a workload manager?
Q/A.answer: It allocates exclusive or non-exclusive access to resources (computer nodes) to users for some duration of time so they can perform work.

Q/A.question: What command is used to run a parallel job on a cluster managed by SLURM?
Q/A.answer: srun

Q/A.question: How does the salloc command function after successfully obtaining a job allocation?
Q/A.answer: It runs the command specified by the user and relinquishes the job allocation when the command is complete.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to check the status of jobs managed by SLURM?
Q/A.answer: squeue

Q/A.question: What does the sacct command display?
Q/A.answer: Job accounting data stored in the job accounting log file or SLURM database, including information on jobs, job steps, status, and exit codes.

Q/A.question: What must be done before starting a Jupyter Notebook on a compute node?
Q/A.answer: Create and activate a Python virtual environment on the compute node and install Jupyter using pip.

Q/A.question: What is required to tunnel a Jupyter Notebook port from a compute node to a local machine?
Q/A.answer: Run the command 'ssh -N -f -L localhost:8888:<NODENAME>:8889 <USERNAME>@<SUBMISSIONNODE>.umiacs.umd.edu' with the appropriate replacements.

Q/A.question: If a Jupyter Notebook has token authentication enabled, what part of the URL must be included to connect?
Q/A.answer: /?token=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

Q/A.question: What was the previous workload manager used at UMIACS before adopting SLURM?
Q/A.answer: PBS/TORQUE

Q/A.question: Which SLURM command corresponds to the PBS command 'qdel'?
Q/A.answer: scancel

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the multi-factor authentication (MFA) requirements implemented by UMIACS for SSH connections?
Q/A.answer: To provide better account and data security.

Q/A.question: What must a user do if they want to use SSH without needing to additionally multi-factor authenticate?
Q/A.answer: Connect to the VPN first.

Q/A.question: Which two authentication methods are currently supported for SSH connections on internal hosts?
Q/A.answer: Interactive password authentication and public key authentication.

Q/A.question: What type of authentication does the multi-factor authentication-enabled SSH on public-facing hosts support?
Q/A.answer: Only interactive password authentication.

Q/A.question: Which hardware tokens are not supported for SSH login specifically according to the UMIACS guidelines?
Q/A.answer: U2F hardware tokens registered with Duo.

Q/A.question: What will happen if a user tries to SSH into another public-facing host after successfully logging in without a VPN?
Q/A.answer: Subsequent SSH attempts will not require multi-factor authentication.

Q/A.question: What prompt appears after entering a password for SSH login with multi-factor authentication enabled?
Q/A.answer: Duo two-factor login for username. Enter a passcode or select one of the following options.

Q/A.question: What does choosing the option 'Phone call to XXX-XXX-XXXX' do during the authentication process?
Q/A.answer: It calls the registered phone and asks the user to press any key on their phone to proceed.

Q/A.question: What is the function of the code shown in the Duo app or on a hardware token during the authentication process?
Q/A.answer: The code is used to authenticate the user.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they want to minimize repeated multi-factor authentication steps while using SSH?
Q/A.answer: First establish a connection over the VPN or use a terminal multiplexer like Screen or Tmux.

Q/A.question: What should a user ensure when submitting a job to a partition that is eligible for preemption?
Q/A.answer: The user is responsible for making sure that their job can be interrupted/restarted gracefully.

Q/A.question: What are the two fields of note set in the output of 'scontrol --json show job $SLURM_JOBID' when a job is cancelled?
Q/A.answer: job_state = ['CANCELLED', 'COMPLETING']

Q/A.question: What signal does the Slurm controller send to the nodes when a job is cancelled?
Q/A.answer: An internal cancel signal.

Q/A.question: What happens to a job once it is stopped due to preemption?
Q/A.answer: It enters the PENDING state for two minutes, and then is eligible to be run again.

Q/A.question: What must be checked to determine if a job needs to behave differently after preemption?
Q/A.answer: The environment variable SLURM_RESTART_COUNT.

Q/A.question: Which command can be used to manually cancel a job?
Q/A.answer: scancel <job id>

Q/A.question: What environment variable is defined when a job runs again after being preempted?
Q/A.answer: SLURM_RESTART_COUNT

Q/A.question: What does SIGKILL do if processes don't stop within a certain amount of time after being cancelled or preempted?
Q/A.answer: SIGKILL will be sent to forcibly terminate the processes.

Q/A.question: What command should a user run within their script to check the job state after a SIGTERM signal?
Q/A.answer: scontrol --json show job $SLURM_JOBID

Q/A.question: What is the equivalent REST API endpoint for the output of 'scontrol --json show job $SLURM_JOBID'?
Q/A.answer: GET /slurm/v0.0.40/job/{job_id}

Q/A.question: What is the first step to change file permissions in Windows according to the provided text?
Q/A.answer: Right-click the file or directory you would like to change permissions for and click on 'Properties.'

Q/A.answer: 'Security'

Q/A.question: Which button must be clicked to access advanced settings for permission changes?
Q/A.answer: 'Advanced'

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of selecting 'Show Advanced permissions'?
Q/A.answer: To view more granular permissions.

Q/A.question: What should you do after selecting the permissions for the user?

Q/A.answer: Users should use GitLab.

Q/A.question: What types of projects does GitLab support as mentioned in the text?
Q/A.answer: GitLab supports personal projects and collaboration with UMIACS users and Offsite users.

Q/A.answer: GitLab provides a multitude of revision control features.

Q/A.question: What is Gurobi Optimizer used for?
Q/A.answer: Gurobi Optimizer is a suite of solvers for mathematical programming.

Q/A.question: How can Gurobi be accessed through the module tree?
Q/A.answer: Gurobi can be accessed through the module tree with the command module add gurobi.

Q/A.question: Where can more information about Gurobi be found?
Q/A.answer: More information can be found on the Modules page.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you encounter the error message 'Error 10009' while using Gurobi?

Q/A.answer: If you're still having issues, please contact the HelpDesk.

Q/A.question: What is the time frame in which the installs must verify activation for UMD-licensed Windows installations?
Q/A.answer: The installs will have to verify activation every 180 days.

Q/A.question: What is necessary for laptops or home machines to perform renewal activation automatically?
Q/A.answer: As long as the laptop or home machine is periodically on the campus wireless or connects to the UMIACS or campus VPN, renewal activation will be performed automatically.

Q/A.question: What network connections are required to activate Windows according to the instructions?
Q/A.answer: You need to be connected to either the wired campus network, campus WiFi, the campus VPN, or the UMIACS VPN to activate.

Q/A.question: What must be done to ensure the time is set correctly for activation to work?
Q/A.answer: Your time must be correct (i.e., set via the Internet) and set to the US Eastern timezone.

Q/A.question: What command is suggested to run before executing the activation commands in case of failure?
Q/A.answer: You can try running w32tm /resync on the command line before running the other commands.

Q/A.question: What is the correct sequence of commands to run in the Command Prompt for activating Windows 10/11?
Q/A.answer: The sequence is: cscript c:\windows\system32\slmgr.vbs -skms kms.umd.edu:1688, cscript c:\windows\system32\slmgr.vbs -ipk NPPR9-FWDCX-D2C8J-H872K-2YT43, cscript c:\windows\system32\slmgr.vbs -ato.

Q/A.question: What command allows you to see when the current activation expires?
Q/A.answer: You can run: cscript c:\windows\system32\slmgr.vbs -xpr to see when the current activation expires.

Q/A.question: Who should you contact if you are unable to activate and the computer is owned by the Institute for Advanced Computer Studies?
Q/A.answer: You should contact UMIACS staff with information about your problem.

Q/A.question: Where should you contact if the computer you are attempting to activate is not owned by the Institute for Advanced Computer Studies?
Q/A.answer: You should contact the Division of IT.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the monthly maintenance window conducted by UMIACS staff?
Q/A.answer: The purpose is to patch and reboot all UMIACS-supported hosts and services to ensure security updates are installed and activated.

Q/A.question: How is the date of the maintenance window determined?
Q/A.answer: The date is calculated by adding 9 days to Microsoft's Patch Tuesday, resulting in a window that is on the Thursday between the 17th and the 23rd of each month.

Q/A.question: What are the operational hours of the maintenance window?
Q/A.answer: The maintenance window lasts from 5pm to 8pm.

Q/A.question: What reservation does Nexus have in place during the maintenance window?
Q/A.answer: Nexus has a reservation from 4:45pm to 8pm on the day of the upcoming window to prevent jobs from being scheduled on compute nodes.

Q/A.question: What happens to jobs submitted before the reservation begins if they run into the reservation time?
Q/A.answer: Any job submitted before the reservation that has a time limit running into the reservation will be held until at least the end of the reservation at 8pm.

Q/A.question: When is the next maintenance window scheduled as stated in the document?
Q/A.answer: The next maintenance window is scheduled for October 17th, 2024.

Q/A.question: Which vendors' patches are included in the maintenance window preparations?
Q/A.answer: Patches released by Microsoft, Red Hat, Apple, and other OS and application vendors are included.

Q/A.question: What is the adjusted time for the maintenance window that began on April 23rd, 2020?
Q/A.answer: The adjusted time for that window was from 5pm to 7pm.

Q/A.question: How long generally does UMIACS maintain the schedule of monthly maintenance windows?
Q/A.answer: The maintenance windows are scheduled to occur consistently on Thursdays between the 17th and 23rd of each month.

Q/A.question: What occurrence might lead to an adjusted date for the maintenance window?
Q/A.answer: An example provided is an adjusted date for an AVW power outage.

Q/A.question: What must you do if you are off the UMIACS network before adding a printer queue?
Q/A.answer: You must first connect to the VPN on Windows.

Q/A.question: What user prefix must be added to your username when authenticating to add a printer queue?
Q/A.answer: 'UMIACS\' must be prefixed to your username.

Q/A.question: What steps should you follow if you receive an error when attempting to add a printer queue due to security configurations?
Q/A.answer: You should click on the Start menu, type 'cmd', right-click and select 'Run as Administrator', then run the specified commands to adjust registry settings and restart the spooler.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to remove a printer queue from a Windows machine?
Q/A.answer: Open the Start menu and search for and go to Control Panel.

Q/A.question: What must you do in order to set duplex printing as the default for a printer?
Q/A.answer: Right-click on the installed printer queue, select 'Printing preferences', go to the 'Printing Shortcuts' tab, select 'EcoSMART Settings', and click OK.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of PIN-protected jobs when printing at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: PIN-protected jobs ensure that print jobs are not printed until the user is ready to pick them up, which is useful for sensitive documents.

Q/A.question: When creating a stored job, what should you select under Job Storage Mode?
Q/A.answer: You should select 'Personal Job'.

Q/A.question: What happens to a print job after it is printed from the printer's control panel?
Q/A.answer: The print job is deleted from memory after it prints.

Q/A.question: What is Google Drive?
Q/A.answer: Google Drive is a file storage and synchronization service developed by Google.

Q/A.question: Who has access to unlimited Google Drive storage at UMD?
Q/A.answer: All current faculty, staff, and students at UMD have unlimited Google Drive storage when using their UMD-provided account.

Q/A.question: Where can the overarching documentation for Google Drive be found?
Q/A.answer: The overarching documentation for Google Drive can be found at https://support.google.com/drive/

Q/A.question: What application does Google currently offer for Drive interaction?
Q/A.answer: Google currently offers a single unified app called Google Drive for Desktop, which can be downloaded.

Q/A.question: Is there a migration step for users who used Google Drive Backup and Sync?
Q/A.answer: Yes, if users previously used Google Drive Backup and Sync, they should follow migration steps provided.

Q/A.question: What platforms does Google Drive for Desktop support?
Q/A.answer: Google Drive for Desktop supports Windows and macOS.

Q/A.question: What messaging features does Mattermost support?
Q/A.answer: Mattermost supports direct one to one messaging, teams with public and private channels, extensive search capabilities, and file sharing.

Q/A.question: Where is the Mattermost platform hosted?
Q/A.answer: The Mattermost platform is hosted in one of the physical on-premise data centers.

Q/A.question: What is required for logging into Mattermost?
Q/A.answer: Logging into Mattermost requires integration with the GitLab authentication system and its MFA requirement.

Q/A.question: What options do users have when signing into Mattermost?
Q/A.answer: Users are prompted to use GitLab to login and then log in with the UMIACS Single Sign On. They can also select which Teams they would like to join by default, including the option to select the UMIACS Team.

Q/A.question: How can faculty, labs, and centers acquire a private Team on Mattermost?
Q/A.answer: Faculty, labs, and centers can request a private Team for their research groups, labs, or centers by contacting staff.

Q/A.question: What type of documentation does Mattermost maintain?
Q/A.answer: Mattermost maintains extensive documentation about using the service, including information about Teams, Channels, and Direct Messages.

Q/A.question: What types of messaging formatting does Mattermost support?
Q/A.answer: Mattermost supports rich text messaging formatting, including using markdown and other simple techniques.

Q/A.question: What applications are available for using Mattermost?
Q/A.answer: There are desktop and mobile applications that can be downloaded for using Mattermost.

Q/A.question: What must users enter when using the desktop and mobile applications for Mattermost?
Q/A.answer: Users need to enter the URL for the service, https://mattermost.umiacs.umd.edu, to sign in and use the service.

Q/A.question: What happens to teams after 6 months of inactivity?
Q/A.answer: Teams will be archived if there is no activity for 6 months within the team channels.

Q/A.question: When will user account data be archived?
Q/A.answer: User account data will be archived when their UMIACS accounts are archived.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the Quarantine Passthrough feature in Barracuda?
Q/A.answer: The Quarantine Passthrough feature allows mail that would ordinarily be quarantined by Barracuda to be delivered to your mailbox instead.

Q/A.question: What is the process to configure the Quarantine Passthrough using the Barracuda web interface?
Q/A.answer: To configure Quarantine Passthrough, log in to the Barracuda web interface with your UMIACS email address and password, click the Preferences tab, select Quarantine Settings, change the Quarantine Enable/Disable option to 'No', and then click Save Changes.

Q/A.question: What will happen to the mail that would have been captured by the Barracuda quarantine filter if the setting is changed to 'No'?
Q/A.answer: If the setting is changed to 'No', all mail that would be captured by the Barracuda quarantine filter will instead be delivered to your mailbox with the tag [QUAR] prepended to the subject line.

Q/A.question: After disabling the quarantine filter, what action may a user decide to take regarding emails?
Q/A.answer: After disabling the quarantine filter, the user may wish to set up a filter to redirect the messages that are now delivered to their inbox to an appropriate folder.

Q/A.question: What command is used to connect a client computer to the UMIACS Nexus under Linux and macOS?
Q/A.answer: # ssh username@nexusgroup00.umiacs.umd.edu

Q/A.question: What must be installed on a macOS client machine to use X11 Forwarding?
